Job Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of.

CD&A - Global Insights Director, Obesity

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world! In this vital role the Global Commercial Insights Director will be responsible for driving commercial insights that shape strategy and key decisions for the obesity pipeline. This includes leading a team that generates insights by integrating a myriad of sources that may include (but not limited to) internal knowledge, strategic secondary analytics, and primary market research.

The individual in this role is a collaborative business partner that can align business questions with impactful insight generation approaches and influence commercial perspectives on franchise/product strategy, brand building, and decisions for internal governance. They are an effective communicator and storyteller and a passionate champion of insights-driven strategy. They can proactively engage partners and drive alignment on an approach that advances thinking and enables objective and data-driven decision-making in the face of ambiguity.

This position reports to the Executive Director for Global Insights, within Commercial Data and Analytics (CD&A) but will work day-to-day with Global partners including Marketing, Value & Access, Forecasting etc.

Flexible Commuter role to Thousand Oaks, US Headquarter site. You will work on-site a minimum of 2 days a week.

Responsibilities

  • Lead teams integrating insights from a variety of sources (e.g., market research, competitive intelligence, secondary data, advisory boards) to address business needs

  • Plan, design and conduct primary market research with a research agency for assets across various phases of the product lifecycle to enable strategic decision making

  • Lead ad hoc strategic secondary analytics to inform strategic decisions

  • Clearly communicate insights and recommendations to a variety of audiences, including senior leadership, and becoming a “devil’s advocate” when needed

  • Partner with commercial leadership and cross-functional partners to define and prioritize objectives, budget and work plans to meet evolving business needs

  • Identify, evaluate, and manage relationships with best-in-class vendors and look for opportunities to innovate and advance capabilities

  • Manage and develop direct reports, while individually leading select projects when needed

  • Ensure that both routine and ad-hoc projects are in compliance with all Amgen SOPs and meet service-level expectations for quality, timeliness, and budget

Win

What we expect of you

We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The professional we seek is a collaborative leader with these qualifications.

Basic Qualifications:

Doctorate degree and 4 years of market research, analytics, competitive intelligence, sales and/or marketing operations experience

Or

Master’s degree and 7 years of market research, analytics, competitive intelligence, sales and/or marketing operations experience

Or

Bachelor’s degree and 9 years of market research, analytics, competitive intelligence, sales and/or marketing operations experience,

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Demonstrated exceptional business acumen, strategic / critical thinking skills, and ability to influence key decisions

  • Ability to independently extract, analyze, treat, and consolidate data from sources in formats with rigor and high level of accuracy and translate into actionable recommendations

  • Excellent oral, written and presentation skills with ability to explain complex concepts clearly to a variety of audiences, including senior management

  • Ability to work collaboratively and adaptively in team-based, cross-functional environments

  • Ability to balance a multitude of stakeholders and projects in parallel

  • Strong knowledge of drug development, commercialization and the broader healthcare industry (patients, HCPs, payers)

  • Experience leading primary research

  • Experience with biopharmaceutical industry datasets and databases

HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

CDnA - Global Forecasting Manager, General Medicine

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will need to skillfully influence and challenge a diverse set of stakeholders from Commercial, R&D, Medical, Finance, Manufacturing, Access, and Pricing/Contracting, while proficiently understanding the nuances of the particular disease area of interest and markets they support.

This role reports to the Director of Forecasting and operates within the broader framework of Commercial Data & Analytics (CDnA).

Flexible Commuter role to Thousand Oaks office. You will work on-site 3 days a week.

Advanced Forecasting Techniques:

  • Ability to build detailed and advanced forecast model (patient, Rx, sales, Rx Based, etc.) projecting units and revenue for Amgen products by indication/regions
  • Use advanced simulation models (e.g., Monte Carlo analysis, statistical trending) to quantify uncertainty
  • Leverage diverse pharmaceutical data sources and their nuances to improve forecasting approaches and methodologies

Market Analysis and Competitor Intelligence:

  • Analyze competitors and market dynamics to inform forecasting models and strategic decisions
  • Develop an objective brand strategy by integrating insights across multiple functions and capability areas

Collaboration and Stakeholder Engagement:

  • Act as the key point of contact for global brand leads, engaging them in forecasting deliverables
  • Facilitate discussions and build consensus among stakeholders to establish clear and rigorous worldwide sales expectations for pipeline assets

Strategic Insights and Recommendations:

  • Support leadership in identifying actionable strategies to improve Commercial potential, prioritizing risks and opportunities
  • Provide informed recommendations on product development continuation or discontinuation based on market conditions, financial projections, and strategic goals

Communication and Presentation:

  • Develop and deliver clear presentations that articulate key variables in the forecast, ensuring comprehensive understanding for decision-makers
  • Apply communication and interpersonal skills to influence leadership on recommended courses of action

Collaboration with CD&A:

  • Collaborate with the broader CD&A organization to integrate comprehensive insights and analytics knowledge into forecast development
  • Improve the depth and accuracy of forecasts by using a broad spectrum of insights across the organization

Process Optimization:

  • Drive productivity and efficiency by streamlining forecasting processes where possible

HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

You’ve worked hard to become the professional you are today and are now ready to take the next step in your career. How will you put your skills, experience and passion to work toward your goals? Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will lead intelligence gathering activities for US and Global marketing teams to support multiple assets across Amgen’s General Medicine and Inflammation Business Unit. This critical role will report directly to the Senior Manager, Competitive Intelligence.

Flexible Commuter role to Thousand Oaks, CA office. You will work on-site 2-3 days a week.

  • Synthesize information from multiple sources to develop strategic insights and point of view on key competitive developments, implications to Amgen and actions Amgen must take.
  • Work in a highly cross functional manner and manage changing priorities across several key customers.
  • Develop productive relationships with global Product Teams to define business problems and develop coordinated analysis plans based on best practice methodologies.
  • Apply structured problem solving to collect, analyze and report CI, incorporating primary and secondary data sources to generate concrete insights.
  • Articulate and educate customers on the relevant impact of changing market dynamics (i.e. reimbursement environment, pharmaceutical/biotechnology regulations, general environmental factors, etc.) to their business from a CI perspective.
  • Organize and facilitate strategic exercises & competitive simulations to generate competitive insights and company plans.
  • Coordinate and facilitate CI collection efforts at major medical conferences/congresses.
  • Manage a network of primary data sources, including vendors and Amgen employees, to enable effective project implementation.
  • Assess the reliability of CI research findings, maintaining high standards for accuracy, relevance, and quality in deliverables at all times and communicate level of evidence to partners.
  • Present on a regular basis in-depth analyses and summaries of results, interpreting and communicating results with recommendations to brand/business partners.
  • Educate the value and importance of CI to new employees (sales, RML, BAI, marketing) and maintain a strong position of coaching/promoting CI through daily efforts.
  • Work to grow competitive intelligence/strategy to support other functions in the organization.
  • Some travel (15-20%) may be required. All activities must abide by and strictly enforce Amgen’s CI Legal and Ethical Guidelines with internal team members and agencies.

  • High-energy, self-motivated, and organized

  • Ability to work collaboratively in team-based environment; Ability to establish/maintain effective working relationships
  • Strong understanding of the latest developments in the biopharmaceutical industry, unmet medical needs and opportunities in the assigned therapeutic area

Job Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of.

Global Forecasting Director, Obesity

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world! The Commercial Data & Analytics Obesity team at Amgen serves as a key partner to Commercial leadership, providing strategic guidance and data-backed insights. This role is instrumental in driving commercial success and shaping future strategies for obesity pipeline assets. In this vital role you will influence and challenge a diverse set of stakeholders from Commercial, R&D, Medical, Finance, Manufacturing, Access, and Pricing/Contracting, while proficiently understanding the nuances of each disease area and markets they support.

The successful candidate will serve as a mentor, developing talent and guiding the team while providing technical guidance in forecasting methodologies. Additionally, the Director will articulate the interplay between Forecasting and related functions within Commercial Data & Analytics (Market Research, Commercial Insights, Competitive Intelligence, and Analytics) in contributing to the forecast.

Flexible Commuter role to Thousand Oaks, US Headquarter site. You will work on-site a minimum of 2 days a week.

This position reports to the Executive Director, Obesity Lead, and will be responsible for the following:

  • Primary point of contact for senior leaders to engage in the forecasting deliverables for the organization

  • Facilitate consensus-building among senior stakeholders to establish clear, transparent, and rigorous WW sales expectations for the pipeline assets by gaining their alignment and endorsement for forecast assumptions

  • Help leadership identify actionable strategies to maximize Commercial potential by identifying and prioritizing relevant risks & opportunities

  • Provide recommendations on whether to proceed with product development or discontinue certain projects based on market conditions, financial projections, and strategic goals

  • Analyze competitors and market dynamics to inform forecasting models and strategic decisions

  • Develop an objective point of view of brand strategy by integrating insights across multiple functions and capability areas

  • Leverage communication and interpersonal skills to influence leadership on recommended course of action

  • Quantify uncertainty through the use of scenario planning and advanced simulation models (e.g. Monte Carlo analysis, statistical trending)

  • Utilize an in-depth understanding of diverse pharmaceutical data sources (eg. LAAD, National Audit Rx, Xponent, Epidemiology data sources etc) and their nuances to develop and implement enhanced forecasting approaches and methodologies

  • Create and deliver effective presentations that are transparent and articulate all key variables in the forecast, ensuring clarity and comprehensive understanding for stakeholders involved in decision-making processes

  • Collaborate with the other CD&A team members to integrate comprehensive insights and analytics knowledge into the development and refinement of forecasts. This collaboration aims to enhance the depth and accuracy of forecasts by leveraging a broad spectrum of insights across the organization

  • Drive productivity and efficiency, streamlining forecasting processes where possible

Win

We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The professional we seek is a collaborative partner with these qualifications.

Doctorate degree and 4 years of forecasting experience

Or

Master’s degree and 7 years of forecasting experience

Or

Bachelor’s degree and 9 years of forecasting experience

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Forecasting experience in the biopharma industry

  • Leadership experience in building and developing hard-working teams

  • Ability to quickly establish credibility with and influence SVP level staff

  • Alignment of teams to best practices and championing new innovative methodologies and tools

  • Eye for business that lends itself to understanding the context and dynamics of pharmaceutical markets for relevant disease areas

  • Partnership with business leaders to deliver high-quality predictions guiding strategic decision-making

  • Oral, written, and presentation skills to explain complex concepts and controversial findings clearly to a variety of audiences, including senior management

CDnA - Associate Director, Marketing Investment Optimization

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. The Amgen Commercial Data Science team is looking for an accomplished analytical leader with the ability to influence executive-level audiences and deliver robust data and statistical analysis of our marketing investment performance.

Flexible Commuter role to Thousand Oaks, US Headquarter site. You will work on-site a minimum of 2 days a week.

  • Analyze marketing performance data, using Python, R, or similar languages with numerical and scientific libraries for statistical analysis (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, scikit, etc.)
  • Design and analyze marketing experiments applying causal inference and hypothesis testing techniques to find opportunities for scaling or optimizing our investment allocation
  • Lead all aspects of the execution of Marketing Mix and Marketing Attribution Models to measure ROI of core marketing activities
  • Execute scenario planning and project outcomes of investment decisions across the portfolio
  • Prepare and effectively communicate business recommendations to executives and business partners
  • Collaborate with several cross-functional partners (e.g., Marketing, Media, Finance, etc.) to help build marketing budgets that improves brand strategical objectives

Win

What we expect of you

We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The professional we seek is a collaborator with these qualifications.

Basic Qualifications:

Doctorate degree and 2 years of Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related experience

OR

Master’s degree and 4 years of Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related experience

OR

Bachelor’s degree and 6 years of Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related experience

OR

Associate’s degree and 10 years of Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related experience

OR

High school diploma / GED and 12 years of Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related experience

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Strong background in leveraging query languages (SQL) to clean, transform, and prepare data using cloud computing platforms (e.g., Databricks, Snowflake, etc.)
  • Good understanding of statistical analysis concepts such as Causal Inference, Bayesian statistics, Regression Analysis, Hypothesis Testing etc.
  • Strong planning skills for simultaneously managing multiple large and complex projects.
  • Track record of interpreting and communicating analytical insights to non-technical audience using clear and concise language.
  • Advanced expertise using statistical analysis libraries in languages like Python, and R.
  • Expertise in pharmaceutical data sets, such as prescriber-plan data, patient-level data, transactional claims, etc.

Flexible Commuter role to Thousand Oaks, CA US Headquarters site. You will work on-site a minimum of 2 days a week.

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. This critical role will focus on maintaining and building relationships with external Opinion Leaders and large medical centers involved in vasculitis, and the broader Rheumatology and Nephrology provider landscape.

The Thought Leader Liaison (TLL) Sr. Manager will report into the Director of Professional and Marketplace Engagement and will join the National team of Rare Disease Inflammation Thought Leader Liaisons in the Inflammation Business Unit. The TLL will be a critical member of the Brand Team and will coordinate closely with field teams. The TLL will be responsible for the following, but not limited to:

OL / Strategic Customer Development and Management

  • Identify, cultivate, and maintain professional relationships with established and up-and-coming regional Opinion Leaders in ANCA Vasculitis (Rheumatology / Nephrology / other specialties diagnosing and managing vasculitis)
  • Support deep engagement of key customers (ex. Navigating IDNs / Centers of Excellence, Professional Organizations, Foundations/Patient Organizations)
  • Manage OL Speaker bureau relationships including supporting speaker training, compliance, and product theater speaker management
  • Manage regional speaker bureau, including providing speaker recommendations
  • Identify, map, and manage relationships with key national Vasculitis Centers and other large treatment facilities (includes the detailed mapping of referral patterns, key relationships, and influencers)
  • Coordinate and leading all one-to-one exchanges between brand team and KOLs across key initiatives and events

Congress / Key Event Management

  • Attend and manage brand activity at key regional and national inflammation conferences (may encompass Rheumatology, Nephrology, Pulmonology), including managing product theaters, and other ancillary brand activities
  • Manage overall regional sponsorship budget, including working with organizations to secure sponsorships, and owning regional congress plan
  • Coordinate executive meetings with OLs at national conferences
  • Complete all necessary conference and speaker contract requirements in a timely manner
  • Coordinate with marketing to ensure all congress materials are delivered on time

Coordinate with sales, marketing, and medical affairs

  • Work cross functionally to drive and develop aligned external engagement strategies across multiple cross functional teams including medical, training, marketing, and sales
  • Coordinate closely with the sales team to ensure alignment with conference OL engagement plan as well as other OL/account engagement
  • Provide customer and market insights back to the marketing team and provide input into P2P development, advisory boards, and strategy
  • Partner with the HCP Marketing team to develop advisory board strategy, content, advisory recommendations, and attend advisory boards as appropriate
  • Provide insights summary from key congresses to the marketing team

Drive key initiatives

  • Leading peer-to-peer marketing initiatives such as advisory boards, speaker bureau & product theater content development
  • Shaping team content development needs include disease state
  • Participate in strategic discussions with brand team

Additional Information:

  • Business travel, by air or car, is regularly required (50% - 65%)
  • Willingness to work evenings and select weekends is required
  • Located near a hub airport is recommended
  • Coverage of West Coast region – Washington, Oregon, California, Idaho, Nevada, Arizona, and Hawaii

  • Produce and deliver regular performance dashboards for Patient Access and Reimbursement team using internal patient support services data like copay card data, nurse program data etc and other syndicated data like IQVIA

The ability to clearly present/communicate findings and recommendations to Senior Leadership is essential.

Flexible Commuter role to Thousand Oaks, CA office. You will work on-site 2-3 days a week.

  • Develop positive relationships while working cross functionally with marketing, finance, the broader CD&A team, and other partners to develop and communicate assumptions based on secondary data analysis and partner input

Job Description:
Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. The Forecasting team at Amgen serves as a key partner to Commercial leadership, providing strategic guidance and data-backed insights. As the Executive Director of Forecasting, you will lead a team of 4-5 directors and oversee a total team size of 30-35 individuals. You will be responsible for providing strategic direction, data-driven insights, and scenario-planning guidance to support critical decision-making processes across the organization. This role requires a dynamic leader who can navigate complex environments, foster collaboration, and drive innovation to maximize the commercial success of Amgen's portfolio. The individual in this role will need to skillfully influence and challenge a diverse set of senior stakeholders from Commercial, Access, Medical, Finance, and Manufacturing, while proficiently understanding the nuances of all therapeutic areas Amgen operates in.

Additionally, the Executive Director of US Forecasting at Amgen will play a pivotal role within the CD&A leadership team, collaborating closely with colleagues to ensure alignment and synergies across functions. This individual will work hand-in-hand with leaders from market research, analytics, competitive intelligence, data strategy, marketing investment optimization, and other relevant areas to leverage their insights and expertise in developing comprehensive and accurate forecasts.

By fostering collaboration and knowledge-sharing among cross-functional teams, the Executive Director will harness the collective intelligence of the organization to inform strategic decision-making and drive business success. This collaborative approach will not only ensure that forecasts are based on the most up-to-date information and analysis but also facilitate a deeper understanding of market dynamics and competitive landscape.

In summary, this role represents an exciting opportunity to lead a talented team and collaborate with diverse stakeholders across the organization to develop robust forecasts that drive business growth and innovation in the dynamic pharmaceutical industry landscape. This position will report in to the AVP of CD&A (forecasting and CI) and will be responsible for the following:

  • Lead and mentor a team of directors to develop transparent, defendable revenue valuations and long-range forecasts for Amgen's portfolio, spanning various therapeutic areas.

  • Collaborate closely with US commercial leaders to understand market dynamics, identify emerging trends, and anticipate future opportunities and challenges.

  • Lead the annual commercial revenue forecast process as well as the monthly performance review process, Latest Estimate (LE).

  • Responsible for leading and coordinating all commercial analytical approaches utilized; ensures quality of output and recommendations, as well as timeliness and relevance of insights to business questions at hand (i.e., ROI, Marketing Analytics, etc.).

  • Facilitate discussions with senior leaders to provide unbiased, transparent views of forecasts and associated risks and opportunities for the full Amgen US portfolio, enabling informed decisions on investments and priorities.

  • Function as a catalyst for critical thinking within the forecast team and among senior-level cross-functional partners, rigorously pressure testing and debating assumptions to ensure the forecast's accuracy and reliability.

  • Take a proactive approach to identify and address potential secondary data issues that could impact forecasts and our collective understanding of the business landscape.

  • Demonstrate proficiency in handling secondary data sets such as IQVIA claims, NPA, Xponent, 852/867, etc., to enhance forecasting accuracy and efficacy.

  • Ability to comprehend and articulate both the business and clinical aspects of forecasting, ensuring a holistic understanding of treatment choices and market dynamics beyond baseline trends.

  • Establish aspirational yet achievable revenue targets and provide actionable forecasting. guidance to enable successful commercial launches and go-to-market strategies.

  • Foster a culture of inclusion, collaboration, and continuous improvement within the forecasting team and across the broader organization.

  • Lead team management efforts, including hiring, training, and performance management, to ensure the development and retention of top talent within the forecasting team.

  • Stay ahead of industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in forecasting, analytics, and market research to drive innovation and enhance forecasting capabilities.

  • Proactively identify opportunities to leverage new technologies and methodologies to improve forecasting accuracy and efficiency.

  • Provide ongoing training and development opportunities for team members to ensure they remain up to date on relevant technologies and methodologies and continue to evolve with changing industry trends.

Win

What we expect of you

We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The professional we seek is a leader with these qualifications.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Doctorate degree & 6 years of forecasting experience OR

  • Master’s degree & 10 years of forecasting experience OR

  • Bachelor’s degree & 12 years of forecasting experience AND

  • 6 years of managerial experience directly managing people and/or leadership experience leading teams, projects, programs or directing the allocation of resources

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Leadership in building and developing high-performing teams, with a focus on fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement.

  • Demonstrated ability to quickly establish credibility with and influence senior executives at the SVP/VP level, effectively communicating complex concepts and insights to drive strategic decision-making.

  • Alignment with best practices and a commitment to championing new and innovative methodologies and tools to enhance forecasting capabilities and drive business outcomes.

  • Business acumen with a deep understanding of the context and dynamics of pharmaceutical markets, particularly within relevant disease areas, allowing for informed decision-making and strategic planning.

  • Experience partnering closely with business leaders to deliver high-quality predictions and insights that guide strategic initiatives, optimize resource allocation, and maximize commercial success.

  • Oral, written, and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex concepts and controversial findings clearly and compellingly to diverse audiences, including senior management and cross-functional stakeholders.

  • Project management experience (planning, prioritization, objective setting, meeting management, and plan execution)

Job Title: Data Manager - Enterprise Asset Management/Computerized Maintenance Management System
Job Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

You’ve worked hard to become the professional you are today and are now ready to take the next step in your career. How will you put your skills, experience and passion to work toward your goals? At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Come do your best work alongside other innovative, driven professionals in this meaningful role.

Data Manager - Enterprise Asset Management/Computerized Maintenance Management System

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this! Let’s change the world! Undertake various projects assigned to develop, implement, manage, and monitor all aspects of system data as it relates to Amgen’s Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) / Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) application.

Responsibilities include:

  • Support initiatives and actively participate on integrating CMMS data with other business systems such as Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems or Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) to provide a comprehensive view of maintenance operations.

  • Act as the in-house data steward/owner for Amgen’s EAM/CMMS database and reporting tools.

  • Be the corporate expert on the information structure within the EAM/CMMS application and develop queries/reports to support standardization.

  • Monitor and audit data quality, taking corrective actions as necessary.

  • Manage data from requirements through retirement to improve business processes and agility while reducing costs.

  • Data validation, clean-up, and adherence to enterprise data standards and business requirements.

  • Improve the methods and ways in which Amgen’s facilities and equipment maintenance program obtains and analyzes data including collecting and interpreting data, analyzing and reporting results, identifying patterns and trends in data, and defining new data collection and analysis processes.

  • Identify digital solutions to improve efficiencies within the Maintenance business processes.

  • Support and assist the business in achieving maximum value from the EAM/CMMS system.

  • Advance the use of EAM/CMMS system functionality/capability to improve workflow and process.

  • Maintain appropriate records and documentation to satisfy regulatory requirements.

  • Analyze maintenance data generated by the EAM/CMMS to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can improve equipment reliability, reduce downtime, and optimize maintenance schedules.

  • Develop and generate reports on key performance indicators (KPIs) related to maintenance activities, such as work order execution, equipment reliability business metrics and maintenance costs.

  • Enable Asset Performance Management (APM) tools to improve the utilization of data analytics to implement predictive maintenance strategies, identifying potential equipment failures before they occur based on historical data patterns.

  • Design and create visualizations and dashboards to help communicate findings and results effectively to team members.

  • Uncover trends and correlations through data mining and analysis to develop insights that can improve the business and help make effective decisions.

  • Collaborate and innovate with Amgen data science team to unlock new value drivers from our data.

  • Partner with functional networks and site management to develop and implement equipment reliability plans.

  • Drive continuous improvement initiatives based on insights gained from data analysis, collaborating with maintenance teams to implement best practices and optimize maintenance processes.

  • Collaborate with Amgen business units, site, and functional partners to deliver results; influence and communicate effectively with clients.

  • Lead initiatives related with data analytics. Lead initiatives interacting with DTI teams responsible for software improvements and engineering teams responsible for analyzing, and interpreting maintenance data.

Win

What we expect of you

We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The dynamic professional we seek is an individual with these qualifications.

Basic Qualifications:

Doctorate degree OR

Master’s degree and 2 years of relevant experience managing the Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) / Computer Maintenance Management System (CMMS) data reporting and analytics, or maintenance engineering experience OR

Bachelor’s degree and 4 years of relevant experience managing the Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) / Computer Maintenance Management System (CMMS) data reporting and analytics, or maintenance engineering experience OR

Associate’s degree and 8 years of relevant experience managing the Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) / Computer Maintenance Management System (CMMS) data reporting and analytics, or maintenance engineering experience OR

High school diploma / GED and 10 years of relevant experience managing the Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) / Computer Maintenance Management System (CMMS) data reporting and analytics, or maintenance engineering experience

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Bachelors degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Business, or Engineering

  • Experience with data system development and management. Knowledge of EAM/CMMS Systems

  • Knowledge of Industry 4.0

  • Experience with Agile methodologies

  • Data analytics skills and proficiency in systems (Maximo, SAP, Excel, Brio, Tableau, and/or Python).

  • Experience with equipment maintenance and reliability centered maintenance (RCM) concepts.

  • Knowledge of ISO 55000 Asset Management Principals

  • Knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, JMP, BO etc

  • Proficiency in data management and analytics tools.

  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and identify trends and patterns.

  • Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in data collection and analysis.

  • Ability to work independently, as well as collaboratively in a team environment.

  • Effective and strong interpersonal and communication skills.

  • Demonstrated skills leading global programs and initiatives.

  • Program development and project management skills.

Amgen recognizes the critical role marketers play in the ability of our brands to deliver outsized impact in the market. As such, we are on a long-term journey to invest in and advance the role of marketing and marketers across Amgen. This role will report to the Director of Marketing Excellence and will play a critical role in building marketing capabilities across our brands and markets.

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will be responsible for oversight, governance and administration of Amgen’s US commercial data and analytics platform. This leader will play a key role in the day-to-day operations of the platform to enable analytics across the Commercial Data and Analytics function as well as other cross functional teams. This role will report to the Director Data Management and will work with a cross functional data governance team that handles execution of the operational health and financial aspects of the data platform.

Flexible Commuter role to Thousand Oaks office. You will work on-site 2-3 days a week.

  • Lead the global commercial data lake(s) & marketing data hub at Amgen as a business owner
  • Lead ground-breaking projects that shape the future of the Data platform as well as integrations of platforms in mergers, acquisitions, etc.
  • Craft multi-year roadmaps for the Data Platform
  • Evaluate new technologies that enable new capabilities for partners and secure leadership sponsorship to implement new capabilities
  • Handle the budget for the platform – including OSE, Run Ops, Infrastructure costs.
  • Lead the yearly and quarterly planning discussions to prioritize features
  • Guide Operations team including vendors in the day-to-day operations of the platform
  • Institute processes to efficiently govern the platform and develop evaluation methods that help understand the health of the platform
  • Lead Vendor selection exercises with GSS and DTI to manage the Platforms Run Ops
  • Seek opportunities to improve the platform for collaborators
  • and increase adoption by optimizing processes, removing redundant processes
  • Implement processes to maintain a YOY Flat line for Infrastructure costs – Lead efforts to optimize processes, purge redundant data, implement automations to streamline processes
  • Foster strong relationships with stakeholders and cross functional leads to ensure alignment in execution
  • Serve as SME for Commercial data sets to other Amgen Functions
  • Lead data collection efforts in support of Legal requests
  • Lead and participate in strategizing the creation of best-in-class data and analytics platforms
  • Develop and oversee ongoing Data Governance & Administration for both Operational and Analytical needs
  • Guide DevOps teams to streamline processes and implement best practices adhering to the Agile methodology to achieve Operational excellence
  • Implement processes to track costs of running the platform, monitor costs and drive innovations to reduce costs and optimize processing
  • Periodically review all processes, identify duplications and inefficiencies and lead organizational change across collaborators base to remediate the inefficiencies
  • Lead collaborative teams including DTI partners, external vendors and service providers to ensure reliability, stability in the service and enhance user – experience and adoption
  • Implement automations to increase stability & accuracy, optimize costs and efforts and reduce turn-around time in meeting partner expectations
  • Implement processes to ensure thorough documentation for all data products
  • Identify business needs and propose potential analytics approaches for solutions
  • Creating prototypes and demonstrations to better access and use data assets
  • Present analysis ideas, progress and results to leadership and business partners
  • Ensuring systems meet business requirements and industry standard processes
  • Assuring compliance with regulatory, security, and privacy requirements as it relates to data assets
  • Ad-hoc projects and analysis would be a standing 10-20% of the role
  • Responsible for the management of both identified as well as de-identified patient data sets

HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. What you will do

In this vital role you will be responsible for planning and executing the launch of UPLIZNA in IgG4 related disease (“IgG4-RD”) in the United States, including leading the cross-functional launch team and partnering with Amgen’s Global team to ensure alignment. The role will involve significant cross-functional collaboration and exposure to senior leadership.

  • Develop and lead execution of the integrated U.S. launch plan for UPLIZNA in IgG4-RD, including all aspects of launch readiness to ensure attainment of business objectives
  • Lead the UPLIZNA IgG4-RD cross-functional launch team, collaborating closely with cross-functional partners including Medical Affairs, Global, Marketing, Market Research, Market Access, Consumer Marketing, Commercial Development, Clinical Development, Regulatory Affairs, Sales, Patient Services, Patient Advocacy, Training, Trade, etc.
  • Serve as U.S. commercial lead for launch planning
  • Drive effective project management, including timely execution of cross-functional workstream, and ensuring deliverables are on-time, aligned to strategy, and on-budget
  • Develop and manage the U.S. commercial launch budget
  • Prepare and deliver regular launch readiness reports to senior management and executive leadership teams
  • Build, lead and develop the U.S. marketing team for UPLIZNA in IgG4-RD (professional marketing & medical marketing), which will co-create core positioning, messaging, and materials in partnership with Amgen’s Global organization
  • Lead IgG4-RD team participation in annual strategic planning process
  • Develop subject matter expertise in the IgG4-RD disease area, including disease pathology, patient journey and treatment landscape
  • Develop the U.S. go-to-market strategy in IgG4-RD in partnership with Field Sales, Field Medical Affairs, Field TLLs, Patient Services, Site of Care, and Commercial Operations
  • Contribute to the forecasting process to ensure that the commercial forecast accurately reflects key insights on market structure, patient journey, HCP preferences, etc.
  • Maintain close alignment with existing UPLIZNA brand messaging and positioning
  • Ensure that all launch activities are informed by customer insights gained from analytics, market research, KOL advisory activities, and field insights
  • Provide strategic input on future organization development to meet customer needs and business objectives
  • Build a culture of collaboration, transparency, and patient-centricity within the IgG4-RD launch team

  • Experience in rare disease strongly preferred

Job Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of.

Medical Director, IgG4 - Rare Disease

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will provide medical/scientific strategic and operational expertise into the planning and execution of the medical support activities of UPLIZNA with a focus on IgG4-RD. This individual will be responsible for Medical Affairs pre-launch and go-to-market launch planning and execution. They will provide medical input into the long-term vision for the Medical Affairs area to enable health care professionals and patients to receive appropriate medical information. This role requires a high level of collaboration across Amgen and will require working closely Research and Development, Access, Commercial, Outcomes Research, and Publications. Forging a productive and compliant partnership with the Commercial organization will be crucial.

Responsibilities:

The successful candidate should have prior experience working in a cross functional dynamic environment with a focus on both strategic and tactical execution. Partnering with Senior Medical Affairs Management, this role includes coordinating cross functional Medical Affairs resources to develop conference/pub plans, mapping KOL development, HCP disease state awareness, planning and go-to-market needs across target markets. Serving as the liaison the R&D team and the rest of medical affairs, this role will ensure bidirectional exchange for internal alignment, content, insight generation, and KOL/advocacy engagements.

  • Partner with Senior Amgen Medical Affairs Management to advance medical and company goals.
  • Leverage clinical and therapeutic qualifications and experience to conceive, develop, and implement projects relevant to advancing the goals of the Medical Affairs Organization at Amgen.
  • Provide therapeutic knowledge or expertise on business development projects and run Medical Affairs transition process after deals completed.
  • Communicate and partner with key external therapeutic experts (HCPs) to provide and support high level clinical education.
  • Provide support to global sales team and customer base through effective resolution of medical and technical questions which cannot be answered by field service organization.
  • Provide a medical perspective to clinical and regulatory organizations, provide subject matter expertise including the utilization of key clinical data and medical trends to effectively differentiate Amgen’s products and services to marketing teams to develop appropriate collateral materials.
  • Develop and support key clinical and medical affairs strategies in conjunction with commercial counterparts. Provide ongoing and interactive technical and medical expertise to executive on these strategies.
  • Interact and present to government, regulatory, and other team members to promote enhancement of the corporation’s reputation.
  • Demonstrate the required “intellectual horsepower” to be a credible expert and develop strong relationships with key opinion leaders, primary and specialty physicians, key professional societies and organizations.
  • Provide expertise in the phase3b/4 development programs and lifecycle management activities for Amgen compounds within therapeutic area as well as business development opportunities.
  • Develop publication plans applying internal and external data sources using therapeutic knowledge and data analysis abilities.
  • Deliver background scientific information and specific scientific project training to relevant internal team members (sales, marketing, business development, field medical team, etc).
  • Lead departmental initiatives regarding support systems and processes to facilitate appropriate conduct and documentation of ongoing project work.
  • Attend and support external medical meetings and conferences.
  • Partner with Amgen Compliance to ensure activities, programs and projects are compliant and consistent with company policies.

Qualifications and Skills Required:

Win

What we expect of you

We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The professional we seek is a self starter with these qualifications.

Doctorate degree and 4 years of Medical Affairs, Gastroenterology and/or Immunology experience

Or

Master’s degree and 7 years of Medical Affairs, Gastroenterology and/or Immunology experience

Or

Bachelor’s degree and 9 years of Medical Affairs, Gastroenterology and/or Immunology experience

  • Medical degree strongly preferred (MD or ex-US equivalent)
  • Relevant clinical therapeutic experience preferred; focus in gastroenterology.
  • 3+ years in gastroenterology and/or immunology.
  • Knowledge of clinical trial development and direction.
  • Outstanding oral and written communication skills.
  • Understands their audience; available and able to engage people with varying degrees of scientific background in a significant and clear dialogue.
  • Demonstrates ability to relate and work with a wide range of people to achieve results.
  • Able to demonstrate problem solving and risk mitigation skills.
  • Possess a professional, proactive demeanor.
  • Personable, likeable, engaging style that encourages morale and partnership.
  • Is able to address issues/concerns in a clear, well-informed manner that engages others in a thoughtful discourse; able to stand up in a polite way and make the case.
  • Exhibits commercial curiosity when evaluating new approaches and solutions.
  • Demonstrates ability to evaluate information and data with a defined, studied process and report results in a thoughtful, organized manner.
  • Willingness to work in a multi-disciplinary team environment.
  • Ability to adapt easily to changing work environment, comfortable with ambiguity.
  • Possesses a collaborative, results-driven style.
  • Proven outside-the-box problem solver and strategist who champions taking calculated risks and accepts new methodologies that drive innovation.
  • Exhibits integrity, honesty and a sense of personal accountability.
  • Up to 30% travel required

Job Title: Salesforce Developer/Tech Lead (Remote for the right candidate)
Job Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

You’ve worked hard to become the professional you are today and are now ready to take the next step in your career. How will you put your skills, experience and passion to work toward your goals? At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Come do your best work alongside other innovative, driven professionals in this meaningful role.

Salesforce Developer/Tech Lead (Remote for the right candidate)

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will be part of the software team to design and develop secure and scalable applications on Salesforce, Salesforce Cloud, Conga CPQ, Conga CLM, and MuleSoft platforms.

You will stay abreast of current Salesforce capabilities and roadmap, adopt standard software development engineering and release processes. You will work closely with product owner/business analyst to understand the requirement, utilize Agile methodology, apply DevOps best practices, and lead a team of 3-5 technologists and software engineers. You will also be leveraging Generative AI technologies to support the evolution of Contracts Management Products at Amgen.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Software application development on Amgen’s Salesforce.com platform using APEX, JavaScript, Visual Force, AJAX, HTML, CSS, and Lightning Web Components

  • Apply standard methodologies to develop application using Salesforce components, Sales Cloud, Community Cloud for integration with MuleSoft, DocuSign

  • Configure Conga CPQ, and Conga CLM applications

  • Configure Salesforce.com application and model custom objects based on the business requirements

  • Understand Salesforce security and apply the Organization Wide Default, sharing patterns, profiles or permissions to the applications

  • Provide leadership skills to drive innovative design to suit business requirements, provide gap analysis, work estimates, support and coordinate technical team's assignments

  • Communicate software design using UML, lucid chart or other modeling tools and software. Collaborate with team members to apply abstractions and service-orientation to foster scalability

  • Develop Test classes and automation to validate business logic and avoid production issues

  • Work with release engineer to organization and manage product delivery backlog, pipeline environments, developers code merge, and validation

  • Work in Copado to run and support Salesforce promotions and deployments

  • Work as part of SAFe Product Team with active participation in requirements gathering, design discussions, development, implementation, and software validation

  • Develop innovation solutions using Generative AI technologies

  • Mentor junior software engineers

  • Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in software engineering, and share this knowledge with technical team

  • Communicate and work optimally in cross-functional teams and collaborate with business partners

  • Build and maintain documentations on software architecture, design, deployment, and disaster recovery

  • Superb communication, presentation, and organization skills

Win

What we expect of you

We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The dynamic professional we seek will have these qualifications.

Basic Qualifications:

Doctorate degree

OR

Master’s degree and 3 years of development experience

Or

Bachelor’s degree and 5 years of development experience

Or

Associate’s degree and 10 years of development experience

Or

High school diploma / GED and 12 years of development Job Code’s development experience

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Proficient in developing and customizing Salesforce.com application via web services, Apex, SOQL, Lightning Web Components, Visual Force, Data Loader, Reports and Dashboards

  • Experience with developing Salesforce dashboards leveraging SFDC APIs, SOSL, SOQL, SOAP or REST based web services, SQL, XML and JavaScript

  • Experience with building and maintaining Custom Objects, and integrating Salesforce with external systems (e.g. Conga, DocuSign, and MuleSoft)

  • Experience with Amazon Web Services and/or Amazon Connect

  • Copado Certificate and experience with Copado deployment process

  • Conga CPQ and Conga CLM Certification is a plus

  • Experience wit DevOps, Build, and Deployment pipeline

  • Outstanding communications, analytical, and problem-solving skills; ability to learn fast

In this vital role you will supervise lab scientists, collaborate closely with toxicologists, pathologists, and scientists within the organization, and with multi-functional teams, perform literature-based evaluation and in vitro assays for various pipeline projects and present the work to cross-functional teams.

Responsibilities:

  • The candidate should be able to independently initiate and drive projects, intellectually supervise junior lab members.
  • Contribute to the project development as well as perform cellular immunological techniques, including multi-color flow cytometry, ELISA, MSD and in vitro immune cell assays.
  • The candidate with experience in human 3D culture system is strongly preferred.
  • The candidate is expected to have extensive immunology training and strong cellular immunology and cell culture technical skills.
  • In addition, the candidate should have strong verbal and written communication skills, be highly motivated, creative and collaborative.
  • The candidate should have a track record of independent critical thinking and scientific achievement in the area of immunology.

Job Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of.

Patient Access Liaison, GOUT

Hawaii Territory Coverage: Honolulu, HI

Ideally, candidate would reside in the territory area stated above or within a reasonable daily commuting distance.

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will provide logistical, non-medical educational assistance to patients and caregivers as well as office and site of care staff, including physicians, nurses, office managers and executives. The PAL works in a highly visible, strong team environment to provide exceptional customer service on all levels. Specifically, listen to patients, interpreting their specific needs and providing friendly, professional and well-informed answers to their non-medical, logistical questions. The PAL will work with the patient to educate on next steps required to gain access to therapy. The PAL will also work to maintain relationships with patients and families, and by extension physicians and their staff and cross-functional partners to support ongoing compliance with therapy. Strong knowledge and demonstrated history of access and reimbursement for buy and bill/infused pharmaceutical products is required. The PAL will work with numerous internal teams, including Market Access, Medical Affairs, Advocacy, Marketing, and Site of Care to facilitate and improve patient access to insurance, medications, financial support, resources and more.

  • Secure written or electronic HIPAA consent to Horizon By Your Side for patients in the assigned geography.
  • Develop relationships with patients and caregivers by engaging via phone, text, email, virtual or in person connections.
  • Assess individual needs of the patient and develop an appropriate education and resource plan of action, considering the patient’s family and team of healthcare providers to empower the patient to become their own advocate.
  • Educate the patient on KRYSTEXXA coverage based on their benefits and the steps needed to gain prior authorization to ensure understanding of the process for medication access.
  • Provide information on co-pay assistance programs, national foundations, and free drug programs by sharing information to patients as appropriate and needed.
  • Provide proactive education to prescribers and sites of care upon patient enrollment on coverage for Horizon rare disease therapies, common prior authorization requirements, and coding and billings requirements.
  • Provide access and reimbursement education based on the enrolled patient’s KRYSTEXXA benefits to physician offices and sites of care.
  • Educate the physician office and/or SOC on KRYSTEXXA coverage based on the patient’s benefits and the steps needed to gain prior authorization to ensure understanding of the process for medication access.
  • Investigate access challenges pre and post-infusion.
  • Partner with Safety and PV and report AE’s and product complaints through medical information.
  • Work closely with the Horizon cross functional team including Case Managers, the Site of Care team, market access, matrix partners and external vendors.
  • Adhere to professional standards compliance guidance, policies and procedures, federal, state, and local requirements.

Win

What we expect of you

We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The [vital attribute] professional we seek is a [type of person] with these qualifications.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Doctorate degree and 2 years of patient services, reimbursement, medical affairs, or account management experience
  • Master's degree and 4 years of patient services, reimbursement, medical affairs, or account management experience
  • Bachelor's degree and 6 years of patient services, reimbursement, medical affairs, or account management experience

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Scientific background and ability to learn product and disease information.
  • Nursing or other clinical background preferred.
  • Orphan or Rare disease experience.
  • Familiarity with HIPAA guidelines and FDA requirements.
  • Familiarity with and Adherence to internal and OIG Compliance guidelines a must
  • Ability to handle difficult patient cases and resolve hurdles.
  • Ability to work in team environment and manage communication with case Liaisons and sales reps.
  • Ability to respond immediately when necessary (within 24 hours) to prevent lapses in treatment.
  • Strong analytical skills and ability to report on meaningful activity in the region.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office.
  • Professional, proactive demeanor.
  • Strong interpersonal skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability and willingness to conduct field travel, as well as to travel to company meetings, client sites, etc. including some overnight and weekend travel (~50%)

Thrive

What you can expect of us

As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being.

The expected annual salary range for this role in the U.S. (excluding Puerto Rico) is $169,392.00 to $207,034.00. Actual salary will vary based on several factors including, but not limited to, relevant skills, experience, and qualifications.

In addition to the base salary, Amgen offers a Total Rewards Plan comprising health and welfare plans for staff and eligible dependents, financial plans with opportunities to save towards retirement or other goals, work/life balance, and career development opportunities including:

  • Comprehensive employee benefits package, including a Retirement and Savings Plan with generous company contributions, group medical, dental and vision coverage, life and disability insurance, and flexible spending accounts.
  • A discretionary annual bonus program, or for field sales representatives, a sales-based incentive plan
  • Stock-based long-term incentives
  • Award-winning time-off plans and bi-annual company-wide shutdowns
  • Flexible work models, including remote work arrangements, where possible

Job Description:
Patient Access Liaison

Arizona Territory Coverage: Tucson and Phoenix

Ideally, candidate would reside in the territory area stated above or within a reasonable daily commuting distance.

HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of.

Patient Access Liaison, GOUT

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will provide logistical, non-medical educational assistance to patients and caregivers as well as office and site of care staff, including physicians, nurses, office managers and executives. The PAL works in a highly visible, strong team environment to provide exceptional customer service on all levels. Specifically, listen to patients, interpreting their specific needs and providing friendly, professional and well-informed answers to their non-medical, logistical questions. The PAL will work with the patient to educate on next steps required to gain access to therapy. The PAL will also work to maintain relationships with patients and families, and by extension physicians and their staff and cross-functional partners to support ongoing compliance with therapy. Strong knowledge and demonstrated history of access and reimbursement for buy and bill/infused pharmaceutical products is required. The PAL will work with numerous internal teams, including Market Access, Medical Affairs, Advocacy, Marketing, and Site of Care to facilitate and improve patient access to insurance, medications, financial support, resources and more.

  • Secure written or electronic HIPAA consent to Horizon By Your Side for patients in the assigned geography.
  • Develop relationships with patients and caregivers by engaging via phone, text, email, virtual or in person connections.
  • Assess individual needs of the patient and develop an appropriate education and resource plan of action, considering the patient’s family and team of healthcare providers to empower the patient to become their own advocate.
  • Educate the patient on KRYSTEXXA coverage based on their benefits and the steps needed to gain prior authorization to ensure understanding of the process for medication access.
  • Provide information on co-pay assistance programs, national foundations, and free drug programs by sharing information to patients as appropriate and needed.
  • Provide proactive education to prescribers and sites of care upon patient enrollment on coverage for Horizon rare disease therapies, common prior authorization requirements, and coding and billings requirements.
  • Provide access and reimbursement education based on the enrolled patient’s KRYSTEXXA benefits to physician offices and sites of care.
  • Educate the physician office and/or SOC on KRYSTEXXA coverage based on the patient’s benefits and the steps needed to gain prior authorization to ensure understanding of the process for medication access.
  • Investigate access challenges pre and post-infusion.
  • Partner with Safety and PV and report AE’s and product complaints through medical information.
  • Work closely with the Horizon cross functional team including Case Managers, the Site of Care team, market access, matrix partners and external vendors.
  • Adhere to professional standards compliance guidance, policies and procedures, federal, state, and local requirements.

Win

What we expect of you

We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The [vital attribute] professional we seek is a [type of person] with these qualifications.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Doctorate degree and 2 years of patient services, reimbursement, medical affairs, or account management experience
  • Master's degree and 4 years of patient services, reimbursement, medical affairs, or account management experience
  • Bachelor's degree and 6 years of patient services, reimbursement, medical affairs, or account management experience

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Scientific background and ability to learn product and disease information.
  • Nursing or other clinical background preferred.
  • Orphan or Rare disease experience.
  • Familiarity with HIPAA guidelines and FDA requirements.
  • Familiarity with and Adherence to internal and OIG Compliance guidelines a must
  • Ability to handle difficult patient cases and resolve hurdles.
  • Ability to work in team environment and manage communication with case Liaisons and sales reps.
  • Ability to respond immediately when necessary (within 24 hours) to prevent lapses in treatment.
  • Strong analytical skills and ability to report on meaningful activity in the region.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office.
  • Professional, proactive demeanor.
  • Strong interpersonal skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability and willingness to conduct field travel, as well as to travel to company meetings, client sites, etc. including some overnight and weekend travel (~50%)

Thrive

As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being.

Cost Accounting Manager

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will be a member of the Global Cost Accounting team that is responsible for the consolidation and analysis of the global inventory and cost of sales. The Manager will also perform the inventory accounting for certain Amgen manufacturing sites. The manager will be accountable to manage and review the work of the outsourced provider that supports this team.

Preferably, the Manager is familiar with international accounting and intercompany process and has prior cost accounting experience. Amgen has a large international footprint and does business in over 75 countries. As a global biopharmaceutical company with over $20 billion in revenue, the Company’s Cost Accounting matters include high value intangibles, mergers and acquisitions, licensing transactions, complex manufacturing, financing transactions, and research and development activities.

  • Perform and review sophisticated journal entries, general ledger account analysis and reconciliation for both SAP and consolidation tool.
  • Prepare and review audit schedules and answer questions from internal and external auditors.
  • Preparation and review of highly developed financial schedules such as footnote, month-end flash reports, accounting memos and other ad hoc schedules, as required by the supervisor.
  • May lead and review accounting control functions and reporting requirements such as: inventory reserves, pre-approval manufacturing, standard costing including absorption tests, excess capacity analysis among other.
  • Special projects to improve accounting processes including digital projects.
  • Consolidate, analyze and report global inventory balances by product/site and perform detailed monthly variance analysis.
  • Work closely with local Finance to help execute Amgen’s operational strategy.
  • Calculate and record intercompany profit-in-inventory (PII) eliminations monthly to ensure compliance with US GAAP.
  • Support quarterly SOX process certification by compiling, sampling and reviewing control documentation.
  • Participate in the annual standard costing process and ad hoc standard costing updates as required by the manufacturing and distribution sites.
  • Actively support Amgen key business initiatives that impact Cost Accounting processes.
  • Perform all assigned monthly accounting close activities including inventory, inventory reserves, pre-approval, excess capacity analysis and manufacturing variances analysis, and journal entries.
  • Interact with Amgen senior and mid-level management.
  • Strong internal control focus in handling business issues of significance to Corporate Accounting.
  • Actively seek opportunities to streamline assigned processes and cross-train with peers.
  • Assist in project management activities and ad hoc analysis as required.
  • Perform inventory accounting for certain Amgen manufacturing sites.
  • Will be accountable to manage and review the work of an outsourced provider that supports this team.

Win

Doctorate degree

Or

Master’s degree and 2 years of experience in general accounting

Or

Bachelor’s degree and 4 years of experience in general accounting

Or

Associate's degree and 8 years of experience in general accounting

Or

High school diploma/GED and 10 years of experience in general accounting

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Educational background in Accounting or Finance
  • Dynamic accounting/finance experience including corporate level public company experience
  • Profit in Inventory (PII) Elimination process and accounting transaction experience in physical vs financial inventory flow.
  • CPA, Audit, Public Accounting experience
  • Experience in driving and implementing change
  • Experience managing outsource partner relationship
  • Experience in financial system implementation
  • Experience in US Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and Foreign Currency transaction accounting and understanding concepts to translate into mentorship for financial reporting
  • Experience in other functional accounting areas (i.e., intercompany, cash, investments)
  • Detail orientated; strong business analytical and data analysis skills
  • Strong written, verbal communication and presentation skills (English and Spanish)
  • Ability to multi-task, prioritize and manage multiple deliverable
  • Influence at all levels including senior management, functions and geographies
  • Ability to work in a cross-functional team environment
  • Drives Results – Sets compelling goals and aggressive schedules for improvement while remaining flexible in a constantly evolving environment
  • Digital literacy including spreadsheet software, Blackline, ServiceNow and SAP
  • Financial business understanding
  • Organizational skills
  • Ability to demonstrate judgment and make appropriate recommendations

Process Development Senior Scientist

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this! Let’s change the world!

The Process Development Senior Scientist is part of Cleaning Characterization group based in Amgen’s Thousand Oaks, CA corporate headquarters, who are responsible for the development of cleaning process design supporting new product introduction in Amgen internal and external manufacturing network for both drug substance and drug product. The cleaning characterization group develops new processes including chemistries, temperature and contact time that support the implementation of cleaning validation studies within Amgen manufacturing sites. The group supports investigation of deviations/non conformances, writes technical cleaning evaluation reports, and supports plant inspections, including Prior Approval Inspections (PAIs).

  • Design and perform planned experiments for developing large-scale processes.

  • Help develop new methods, apparatus and procedures for bench-scale characterization work and scale-up.

  • Write technical reports, assessments, and procedures.

  • Use characterization data to develop key operating parameters (KOPs), testing requirements and acceptance criteria for new product launches.

  • Work with Quality, Engineering and Process Development to implement Validation requirements at full scale.

  • Help write technical papers for internal and external publication.

  • Chemical Engineering Background with validation and laboratory studies experience.

  • Design and execution of bench-scale experiments.

  • Analytical methods: Total Organic Carbon (TOC), protein assays, gel electrophoresis, spectroscopic methods.

  • Characterization and validation of processes for biologicals.

  • Good knowledge of scientific principles, methodologies and practices.

  • Lab methods, including handling and dispensing chemicals, preparing buffers and operation of common lab equipment, such as pH and conductivity meters.

Senior Associate - Discovery Protein Science

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. Amgen’s Large Molecule Discovery & Research Data Sciences organization is seeking a collaborative Senior Associate to join the Discovery Protein Science (DPS) group at our South San Francisco site. DPS is responsible for designing, planning and executing on the generation of key enabling reagents to support early discovery of small and large molecule therapeutics and ground-breaking modalities. In this vital role you will support Amgen's early drug discovery pipeline

  • You will be a part of a multidisciplinary team with capabilities in molecular engineering, cloning, expression and purification of proteins, including antibodies, multispecifics and membrane proteins.

  • The central focus of this role will be supporting our early drug discovery pipeline by generating fit for purpose protein reagents.

  • The preferred candidate will have broad laboratory training, deep scientific curiosity, and a positive approach to working in a team-based research environment along with a track record of creative problem-solving and enthusiasm for taking on difficult research challenges.

  • Hands-on biochemical analytical experience (spectrophotometry, SDS PAGE, Western blot)

Scientist - Translational Immunology

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will independently conduct immune-related safety assessment experiments to support pipeline programs at Amgen.

  • Design, perform and analyze in vitro immune cell-based assays to support safety assessment of Amgen’s Oncology, Inflammation, Cardiometabolic, Rare Disease, and Biosimilar pipeline programs

  • Perform a wide range of immunological techniques, including isolation and treatment of primary immune cells to analyze various endpoints, mixed lymphocyte reaction assays, multiparametric flow cytometry, and ELISA/MSD/Luminex

  • Support the development and validation of new immunological assays and novel technology to assess potential safety liabilities across therapeutic areas and modalities

  • Perform literature-based evaluations to contribute to project development and assay design

  • Function as part of a highly collaborative team, possess excellent organizational, written and verbal communication skills and demonstrate the ability to produce reliable and reproducible data

  • Present research findings to Translational Safety colleagues and across functional teams

  • Recent PhD or MD in the field of immunology

Or

Preferred Qualifications:

  • The candidate is expected to have basic immunology training and strong cellular immunology and cell culture technical skills

  • The candidate should be able to independently initiate and drive projects, and intellectually contribute to project development

  • In vitro experience with cultured cell lines, western blotting, RNA/DNA isolation is preferred

  • The candidate has demonstrated a track record of independent critical thinking and scientific achievement in the area of immunology

Job Title: Head of Consumer Marketing, UPLIZNA- Rare Disease
Job Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of.

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will be responsible for leading, planning, and implementing the consumer marketing strategy and all patient-focused touch-points critical to the commercial success of UPLIZNA.

Critical to the role will be developing and evangelizing an in-depth understanding of the consumers in NMOSD, gMG, and IgG4-RD. The candidate will be responsible for strengthening brand awareness, driving patient acquisition and defining and implementing opportunities to disrupt this competitive space.

The ideal candidate will use diverse elements of the marketing mix to deliver an excellent patient experience, while continuously improving the efficiency and effectiveness of our communications.

This individual will have Rare Disease experience, preferably in neurology and/or immunology. They will have deep patient marketing experience and brand launch experience. They understand and prioritize the nuances and the importance of connecting HCP and Patient strategies.

The Head of Consumer Marketing is a critical leader within the UPLIZNA Marketing team, with a team of direct and indirect reports, and is the primary voice of the consumer/patient on a cross-functional team that includes internal and external partners. This position will also be responsible for leading and managing patient focused agencies and media strategy across multiple consumer audiences.

Responsibilities include:

  • Leading the evolution and implementation of an innovative, powerful multi-channel consumer marketing plan, from media and communication strategy to patient onboarding and engagement.
  • Producing compelling campaigns across consumer audiences through the development of breakthrough creative including video, digital, social, website, email/CRM and POC.
  • Ownership of the consumer-focused campaigns including new creative executions.
  • Fostering a culture that celebrates a team of diverse experiences and backgrounds and elevating staff’s marketing potential through development and coaching.
  • Creating a highly collaborative and effective cross-functional team that challenges conventions and seeks to set a new standard for patient connectivity.
