Job Title: Medical Director, Global Medical Affairs - Inflammation/Allergy
Job Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of.

Medical Director, Global Medical Affairs - Inflammation/Allergy

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will support the implementation of US Medical strategy and tactics, under the guidance of the US Medical Team Leader (Asset-Lead). Key core responsibilities include: implementing strategy and managing tactics for the patient-education program, overseeing implementation of the US digital communication strategy, supporting medical field team training, and coordinating congress logistics across medical and non-medical functions.

  • Assisting the US Medical-Asset Leader in the execution of US product medical strategy, via implementation of the US Medical Plan. Activities include developing tactics aligned with the US strategy and supporting indications via support of US Launch Readiness Teams;
  • Developing and leading asthma patient-education program in partnership with Medical field team and Scientific communication team;
  • Developing and coordinating the US Digital communication strategy with key internal and cross-partnership team members;
  • Leading US medical congress preparations, including logistics / medical field coordination and engagement with external stakeholders, especially US key opinion leaders (KOLs), US patient advocacy groups and US professional societies;
  • Helping to identify scientific and clinical outcomes evidence gaps and assisting in the development of US evidence generation strategy, in coordination with the Global team
  • Safety and pharmacovigilance as a key and effective partner with Global Regulatory Affairs and Strategy (GRAAS) team

Key Activities:

  • Enhances Amgen‘s value proposition of respective product(s) through management of delegated US medical and scientific activities, in alignment with US medical strategy;
  • Assist in the development of US cross functional strategy and support medical execution of tactics.
  • Support distribution of data and disease state education communication strategies, with special focus on digital strategies and measurement of impacts (metrics)
  • Provide analysis and context for Medical field team-collected insights and ensure appropriate incorporation into US Medical Plan tactics
  • Contribute Medical / Scientific input into Value Dossiers, compendia and interactions with payers in collaboration with Value, Access and Policy (VA&P) team
  • Provide input into medical value and access strategy, asset development and field team training for Payer medical engagements.
  • May participate in speaking engagements that represent Amgen to external and internal bodies on medical and scientific issues related to relevant product(s)
  • Ensure understanding and incorporation of patient perspectives in all activities.
  • Support external Stakeholder Strategy
  • Participate in advocacy from a medical perspective in partnership with Commercial, Government Affairs and Commercial Communications
  • Build Amgen‘s reputation as a science-based and patient-focused reliable partner
  • Ensure appropriate medical review in coordination with compliance function; accountable for the conduct of medical activities according to all relevant compliance standards, regulations and SOP`s; Role models appropriate and compliant behaviors and contributes to creating a climate of compliance adherence across the organization

Win

What we expect of you

We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The dynamic professional we seek is a leader with these qualifications.

Basic Qualifications:

Doctorate degree and 4 years of relative experience

OR

Master’s degree and 8 years of relative experience

OR

Bachelor’s degree and 10 years of relative experience

In addition to meeting at least one of the above requirements, you must have at least 4 years experience directly managing people and/or leadership experience leading teams, projects, programs, or directing the allocation or resources. Your managerial experience may run concurrently with the required technical experience referenced above

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Accredited fellowship in Allergy and Immunology (board certified or board eligible), Otolaryngology (board certified or board eligible) or Pulmonology (board certified or board eligible) OR completed post-doctoral research in biomedical research
  • Demonstrated ability as a medical expert in a complex matrix environment
  • Pharmaceutical product development, product lifecycle and commercialization process knowledge with understanding of other functions; including, but not limited to, Clinical Operations, Commercial, Safety, Regulatory, Value & Access, and Medical Affairs

Job Title: Director Medical Science Liaison, IgG4 - Rare Disease
Job Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of.

Director Medical Science Liaison, IgG4 - Rare Disease

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will direct, develop and support the activities of Medical Science Liaisons (MSLs) within their assigned region. You will be accountable for the attainment of clinical and business objectives for the marketed and pipeline compounds they represent.

Responsibilities:

  • The Director Medical Science Liaison is accountable for the direction and successful execution of the MSLs goals and clinical/business objectives.
  • Accountable for strategic planning, financial management, personnel management, performance management, professional development, training and execution of organizational goals and objectives.
  • Responsible for driven business analysis and clinical positioning of a designated product line in designated region.
  • Ensures field medical team adheres to corporate guidance on compliant ways of working with the commercial organization and other relevant internal team members.
  • Collaborates with and assists the National Director, Field Medical Affairs and Medical Affairs Operations with clinical/business strategy, tactical planning, impact goal development, and quantification of impact of field medical team.
  • Takes initiative and innovates to enhance the effectiveness of the MSLs role and U.S. field medical function.
  • Maintains clinical and business knowledge of designated therapeutic area/product(s), including current treatment strategies, competitive marketplace, and new therapeutic developments. Continually educates self on market issues / trends and product knowledge.
  • Analyzes local and regional business needs by working with the clinical and commercial organizations, as appropriate, to find opportunities where the MSLs function can collaborate.
  • Ensures that MSL team members maintain adequate communications and interaction with the in-field commercial organization, which consists of the District Managers (DM), Regional Managers (RM) and Specialty Account Managers (SAM), when appropriate.
  • Ensures MSLs have the necessary tools, training, and materials to perform their responsibilities effectively.
  • Accountable for the MSL team member to adhere to regulatory and compliance guidelines in all aspects of scientific dissemination of information.
  • Works collaboratively with other Director Medical Science Liaisons to ensure standardization and consistency of MSLs role as well as sharing successes and challenges to learn from.
  • Responsible for providing consistent and timely feedback to MSLs regarding their individual performance and progress.
  • Establishes a productive work environment by consistently demonstrating and instilling Amgen’s core behaviors.
  • Ensures MSL team members update and maintain all required databases with current and complete information. Ensures appropriate documentation of external customer interactions and responses to unsolicited requests in CRM (Veeva).

Qualifications and Skills Required:

Win

What we expect of you

We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The professional we seek is a self starter with these qualifications.

Basic Qualifications:

Doctorate degree & 4 years of Medical Affairs experience

OR

Master’s degree & 8 years of Medical Affairs experience

OR

Bachelor’s degree & 10 years of Medical Affairs experience

And

4 years of managerial experience directly managing people and/or leadership experience leading teams, projects, programs or directing the allocation of resources

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Advanced scientific or clinical degree (MD, PhD, or Pharm D) preferred
  • Previous strategic launch experience required.
  • Exceptional oral and written communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Demonstrates strong leadership through building and maintaining effective teams.
  • Ability to work effectively in a matrix environment and develop strong relationships with a broad range of internal team members (including commercial, clinical, regulatory, legal, compliance)
  • Deals with ambiguity and uncertainty in a calm, thoughtful and professional way.
  • Understands the changing healthcare environment and thinks strategically to suggest and develop new scientific approaches to meet the needs of customers.
  • Knowledge of treatment guidelines, clinical research processes, FDA regulations, OIG guidelines and research or clinical experience in the management of pain and/or rheumatic disease is desired.
  • Knowledge and understanding of clinical and regulatory guidelines.
  • Understands and demonstrates compliant ways of working with the commercial organization.
  • Ability to travel up to 75% for personnel management, observing MSL scientific interactions, understandings customer perceptions and needs, attend regional and international conferences/workshops, and internal meetings.
  • Ability to respond appropriately to needs of customers, key team members and manage expectations.
  • Demonstrated excellent project management skills and follow through.
  • Ensure appropriate utilization of field resources and that they are aligned with Amgen legal and all applicable regulatory guidelines to ensure medical and scientific accuracy and fair balance.
  • Builds strong relationships with peers and cross functional partners outside of team to enable higher performance
  • Learns fast, grasps the 'essence' and can change the course quickly when necessary.
  • Sets a higher standard and is never satisfied with the status quo.
  • Creates a learning environment, open to suggestions and experimentation for improvement.
  • Embraces the ideas of others, nurtures innovation and leads innovation to reality.

Manager, Transformation Analytics

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will support the Results Delivery Office and Amgen leadership by using advanced analytics and strategic thinking to characterize business performance across the enterprise, evaluate potential transformation opportunities, and enable step change in business outcomes. The ideal candidate will demonstrate their analytical foresight to challenge the status quo, drive continuous improvement, and embed digital ways of working into our end-to-end processes.

The role will support the design and development of analytical capabilities to measure and improve enterprise business performance and provide insights for top priority persistent business questions. Ultimately, this role will support data-driven decision making, building a foundational capability to provide end-to-end insight into business process performance and improvements.

This role will interact with a wide range of cross-functional business partners at all levels to understand processes, analyze data, and articulate comprehensive value delivery (cost, speed, risk, quality, etc.)

Objectives of this Role

  • Support design, build and maintenance of a leading-edge capability to analyze financial and non-financial information across the enterprise to derive critical business insights for enterprise transformation and opportunity identification
  • Support the buildout of a sustainable platform for workforce transformation, which connects several domains of data to enable better decision making around our capabilities, finances and workforce
  • Develop and maintain financial and non-financial baseline for programs and initiatives, identifying trends and opportunities for transformation by analyzing complex data sets
  • Create a robust management reporting capability based on data mining, analysis, and visualization
  • Analyze data to answer key questions from senior leaders with an eye for what drives business performance, investigating and communicating opportunities of comprehensive value delivery

Job Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with business and initiative leadership to define data sources and transformation needed to develop a platform for workforce transformation
  • Develop an “always live” long range plan for the enterprise to allow us to quickly respond to and contextualize external and internal signals, and assess impact to the organization
  • Manage the development and maintenance of data models and analytical toolsets (e.g., Tableau, Anaplan, Power suite) required to deliver insights at scale
  • Assist in cross functional analytics projects from beginning to end from building relationships with key business leaders to collecting and analyzing data, as well as summarizing and presenting key insights in support of decision making
  • Influence transformative thinking and decisions with analytical insights and an ability to build collaborative relationships
  • Partner with business areas to share data standard methodologies and support implementation (where applicable)
  • Assist in developing business cases and strategic recommendations, perform ad hoc analyses, and support special projects
  • Interact with various finance and resource planning groups across Amgen to understand impact to budget/long range plans
  • Develop executive communications and present analysis and insights to Amgen’s senior leadership

Win

Doctorate degree

High school diploma / GED and 10 years of data science, business, statistics, data mining, applied mathematics, business analytics, engineering, computer science or related field experience

  • Experience with developing / overseeing development of analytical dashboards using a variety of tools/packages, e.g. Tableau, Python, R, Alteryx, Powerapps, UI Path etc.
  • Experience setting up reporting layers, maintenance & use of reporting tools
  • Comfortable in "start-up" environment of a newly created Amgen group whose remit is to build a durable and data driven transformation capability

Specialist Manufacturing - Digital Manufacturing

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this role you will be part of Amgen's newest and most advanced final product assembly, labeling and packaging plant. The Final Product facility features the best in-class device assembly and packaging technologies with embedded industry 4.0 capabilities.

As a Specialist Digital Manufacturing, you will be part of a dynamic team that leads various smart manufacturing technologies and computerized systems improvement initiatives within manufacturing to support the end user on the shop floor as well as support the business with data analytics and reporting. You will own critical processes, provide technical leadership, and be accountable for designing, implementation, validation and lifecycle management of these systems and digital technologies. This role is critical for Amgen Ohio’s success and key in supporting operations towards a more digital future.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Demonstrate broad technical knowledge on various smart technologies and business systems used in the network. (e.g. AR/VR Technology, MES, ERP, SCADA, Systech, Serialization, user authentication).
  • Recognize and demonstrate understanding of interdependencies between key business systems, smart technologies and the manufacturing business process to assess impact to the organization.
  • Supporting the site in project approvals, project management, prioritization, and leading all aspects of the roll-out and implementation of manufacturing technology concepts for the manufacturing area.
  • Act as manufacturing business owner and SME for key computerized systems (e.g. MES, ERP, SmartVision) and ensure timely implementation of projects including software or system lifecycle management.
  • Collaborate with the MES Global network to drive/influence system enhancements and standardization of the system, documentation, and electronic batch records.
  • Apply independent input and judgment to trouble shoot key computerized systems and digital technologies during problem solving to drive process efficiencies.
  • Apply analytical skills to evaluate and interpret complex scenarios and provide insight in business critical key performance indicators and OEE (e.g. key performance indicator tools, OEE, Spotfire, Tableau) by using qualitative research and data.
  • Develop materials and coordinate/schedule training sessions for delivering training of new and existing manufacturing personnel on topics related to manufacturing technologies.
  • Collaborate with cross functional teams to develop new processes and drive continuous improvements to unlock capacity and increase efficiency within the manufacturing area.
  • Supporting system and document lifecycle management for key computerized systems and business processes and represent the team during project meetings.
  • Generate, and review documents (SOPs, FORMs, Deviations, CAPA, CC, validation protocols, etc.) associated with and owned by the digital manufacturing team.

Win

We are looking for a collaborative partner with a passion for digital manufacturing and data analytics, who can bring the following qualifications:

Basic Qualifications:

Doctorate degree

Or

Master’s degree and 2 years of Manufacturing, Engineering, Business Analysis or Computer Science experience

Or

Bachelor’s degree and 4 years of Manufacturing, Engineering, Business Analysis or Computer Science experience

Or

Associate degree and 8 years of Manufacturing, Engineering, Business Analysis or Computer Science experience

Or

High school diploma / GED and 10 years of Manufacturing, Engineering, Business Analysis or Computer Science experience

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Hands-on experience with some of the key computerized systems (MES, ERP, SCADA) and/or digital manufacturing technologies (AR/VR Technologies, biometric user authentication, SmartVision, Serialization) including troubleshooting, reliability, and performance improvements.
  • Experience in participating and helping lead cross-functional teams toward implementation of digital technologies.
  • Demonstrate comprehensive understanding of the Manufacturing process with the ability to translate to critical business requirements to enable design of computerized systems for the end user.
  • Expertise with translating business/user needs to user requirements and recommend solutions for automation.
  • Data/process performance analysis and reporting experience by using analytics, visualization, and database technologies (critical metrics, OEE, Spotfire, Tableau)
  • Experience with design, configuration, qualification/validation in digital manufacturing and computerized systems and system integration supporting manufacturing and the end user e.g. MES, ERP, SCADA, Systech, Serialization.
  • Analytical fact-based problem solver and strong troubleshooting skills on process, equipment, technology, and computerized systems.
  • Experience in individually supporting key manufacturing systems with 24x7 operations.
  • Ability to maintain an environment of operation excellence, continuous improvement, and lean manufacturing (Kaizen process improvements).
  • The ability/experience of working in fast paced manufacturing environment where issues must be assessed, understood, and resolved immediately to be able to adapt quickly to the demands of commercial manufacturing operations.
  • Experience in a GMP environment and able to work within full GMP compliance.
  • Collaborate with staff at all levels in the organization, including technical and management staff within manufacturing, process development, and quality.
  • Pro-active, result oriented, and ability to prioritize work to meet timelines.

Job Title: Global New Asset Medical Affairs Lead - Inflammation
Job Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of.

Global New Asset Medical Affairs Lead - Inflammation (GNAMAL)

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will lead the Global Medical Affairs strategies for Amgen’s Inflammation early and late pipeline portfolio of marketed and pipeline assets. Represents Global Medical Affairs to lead and drive the development and execution of medical strategies, to include but not limited to, CD-19 Autoimmune workstream, AMG 378, AMG 691, AMG 570, and AMG 592 to increase Amgen’s value proposition in alignment with product and franchise strategies. Provides leadership on strategies for evidence generation, scientific communication, Global launch execution, and external engagement. Amgen has an established portfolio of marketed products in Inflammation and is developing novel strategies for rapidly advancing the Inflammation pipeline. The successful candidate must have experience in recruiting and building medical affairs teams to support molecules as they advance into registration enabling studies, supporting marketed products, and partnering with local Medical Affairs teams to develop strategies that enable access to Amgen’s innovative new therapies. Finally, this role will be a key part of the Global Medical Affairs Inflammation Senior Leadership Team reporting to the Vice President, Global Medical Affairs Inflammation Therapeutic Area Head.

  • Serves as the Global New Asset Medical Affairs Lead (GNAMAL) on various global strategic teams, including Product Teams and the Evidence Generation Team.
  • Leads Inflammation Global New Asset Medical Affairs strategies/activities/development related to CD-19 Workstream, AMG 592, AMG 570, AMG 691 partnering with cross-functional leaders in Global Development, Commercial, and other functions to develop Amgen’s overall strategy in Inflammation.
  • Leads and ensures effective launch excellence, external partner management, scientific communication (e.g., clinical narrative framework, scientific platform, core content, Congresses, and publications), Evidence Generation, medical education, and medical insights.
  • Gathers clinical/scientific insights across all key markets and translate them into actionable strategies. Internal Use Only General and Administrative
  • Facilitates scientific engagements across a broad range of partners, including but not limited to, advisory board meetings and participation in international scientific venues strengthening our understanding of medical opportunities associated with pipeline assets.
  • Aligns and implements strategy for medical communications and related activities, e.g., product narrative, scientific platform, core content, publications, medical education, and Congresses.
  • Develops medical strategic plans and ensures consistent execution of outputs through Medical Affairs Teams.
  • Contributes to Amgen's Safety and Benefit/Risk profile of a molecule and ensures communication of the implications to external partners, Support Investigator Sponsored Studies (ISS), and approve grants, if applicable.
  • Provides strategic direction for study design and implementation for medical affairs and other global studies.
  • Works in close collaboration with the Global Pipeline Execution Lead, or reports, on execution of clinical studies. This with the intent of providing strategic and scientific support and accelerating clinical programs.
  • Facilitates and continues to build Amgen’s role as a science-based, patient-focused partner.
  • Determines resource and budget allocation vital to deliver on medical strategies.
  • Provides mentorship and guidance to local Inflammation Medical Affairs teams.
  • Recruits and builds the Global New Asset Medical Affairs Inflammation team, as needed.
  • Provides cross-product, strategic medical perspective to key commercialization forums.
  • Provides input into strategies for ensuring reimbursement and access to Amgen’s Inflammation Portfolio globally.
  • Continues to enhance Amgen’s reputation as a science-based, patient-focused partner.

Win

OR

  • PhD/PharmD will be considered based on individuals’ profile

  • Knowledge of Good Clinical Practices (GCP) and global regulations and guidelines Internal Use Only General and Administrative
  • Knowledge of pharmaceutical product development, product lifecycle, and commercialization processes, including but not limited to, Clinical Operations, Commercial, Regulatory, and Medical Affairs
  • History of solving problems while exhibiting sound scientific/medical judgment and a balanced, realistic understanding of issues
  • In-depth understanding of scientific method and clinical applications based on medical, scientific, and practical rationale
  • Track record of successfully working with matrixed cross-functional teams

Job Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of.

Senior Manager Packaging Engineering

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this role the Senior Manager Packaging Engineering will support the development and implementation of technical solutions for a variety of packaging engineering initiatives supporting the FDP product portfolio at the Amgen Ohio manufacturing site. The position is a key role in the Combination Product Operations (CPO) group and the candidate must manage and/or apply extensive technical and packaging expertise in the coordination of multiple, sophisticated, non-routine projects involving the planning, design, maintenance and verification of packaging design and processes. This position will also be required to apply advance and diverse engineering principles to more than one area of engineering (design, process, unit operations, equipment, and materials) in complex process characterization, validation, optimization, scale up or manufacturing support projects. This position is expected to frequently spend time on the manufacturing floor via GEMBA walks to engage with manufacturing team and staff as part of continuous improvement in our processes, purpose, and people development.

Key responsibilities will include.

  • Lead, inspire and drive a team of experts in Secondary Packaging to enable a new highly automated site to deliver on multiple new lines and improve recently validated production lines.
  • Act as the site technical expert lead for packaging design, materials, and design for manufacturing. The candidate is expected to use technical design and process knowledge and identify the required expertise to resolve process challenges as needed. The candidate will also be responsible for leading the development of packaging and packaging staff at AOH. Integrate with packaging suppliers to improve performance and trouble shooting materials issues applying scientific methods to determine root cause.
  • Collaborate with equipment suppliers to understand the inter dependencies of packaging materials vs equipment performance, document performance-based requirements in specifications (drawings) to drive sustainably higher OEE.
  • Enable site to meeting manufacturing operating assumptions by driving continuous improvement programs within the site and network.
  • Ensure Amgen network inclusion to implement lessons learned and standard processes enabling speed and agility when introducing new materials and process.
  • Develop Packaging Engineering team and ensure team is integrated within AOH site operations.
  • Build a diverse team of various abilities which include SME’s in paper, plastic, adhesives, etc to ensure specification with materials vs equipment align and optimized.

Operational Excellence

Responsible for supporting the delivery of productivity, throughput, and general capacity improvements across the AOH site by analyzing, designing, and implementing manufacturing and business process improvements.

Relationships

The Senior Manager of Packaging Engineering (Ohio) is expected to leverage and continuously build our network of FDP secondary packaging expertise across the Amgen commercial and clinical operations for product assembly, label, and packaging. The position is expected to leverage this network in support of GMP technical expertise, performance trending, equipment standardization and troubleshooting/process improvements at AOH.

Win

What we expect of you

We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The packaging professional we seek will posses these qualifications.

Basic Qualifications:

Doctorate degree in Engineering, Physical Sciences or related fields and 2 years of packaging, manufacturing, or other directly related experience

Or

Master’s degree in Engineering, Physical Sciences or related fields and 6 years of packaging, manufacturing, or other directly related experience

Or

Bachelor’s in Engineering, Physical Sciences or related fields and 8 years of packaging, manufacturing, or other directly related experience

Or

Associate’s degree in Engineering, Physical Sciences or related fields and 10 years of packaging, manufacturing, or other directly related experience

Or

High school diploma / GED and 12 years of packaging, manufacturing, or other directly related experience

In addition to meeting at least one of the above requirements, you must have a minimum of 2 years experience directly managing people and/or leadership experience leading teams, projects, programs, or directing the allocation or resources. Your managerial experience may run concurrently with the required technical experience referenced above

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Leadership – Development of our staff, delegation of work, inspiring our staff and communications.
  • Expert understanding of multiple packaging disciplines (design, process, and equipment) in a highly regulated environment.
  • Drive design and execution for manufacturing, and continuous improvement.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills together with demonstrated ability to work in a team environment.
  • Proven track record of leading and executing cross-functional projects.
  • Strong teamwork, excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Direct experience with the manufacturing process for packaging operations.
  • Experience of working and improving packaging material suppliers.
  • Ability to work in a highly regulated and ever-changing industry.
  • Ability to learn and rapidly adapt to new requirements in a fast-moving environment.
  • An Operational Excellence approach to work product – driving rapid results.
  • A passion to deliver an excellent work product and develop others with an infective positive attitude!

As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being.

Job Title: Head of Regulatory Affairs Policy & Regulatory Intelligence
Job Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

At Amgen, every challenge is an opportunity. And every opportunity brings the potential to change lives. Our shared mission—to serve patients—has driven our status as one of the world’s preeminent biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Leverage your high-level expertise to lead and forge partnerships that advance the biotechnical and biopharmaceutical science that can turn the tide of serious, life-interrupting illnesses.

Head of Regulatory Affairs Policy & Intelligence

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role as Head of Regulatory Affairs Policy & Intelligence you are responsible for shaping Amgen’s regulatory policy strategy and leading the global policy and regulatory intelligence teams.

Reporting to the Senior Vice President, Global Regulatory Affairs, this key senior leadership role serves as a recognized regulatory policy leader and influential spokesperson in support of Amgen’s global regulatory initiatives.

The Head of Regulatory Affairs Policy & Intelligence leads a team of remote professionals located in both the United States and Europe who are responsible for harnessing their diverse, broad, and industry-leading expertise to influence regulators on important issues in drug development and regulation that benefit Amgen’s business and the patients we serve.

The evolving regulatory landscape and changes in the competitive market require agile and strategic regulatory policy engagement to support Amgen business needs. This leader will deliver leading-edge regulatory results by identifying policy barriers and emerging trends, developing advocacy plans built upon science-based positions, engaging broad stakeholder networks, and ultimately effecting change in regulatory policies that reduce regulatory risk and improve efficiency in drug development.

Responsibilities

  • Lead teams of policy experts and subject matter experts to accomplish policy goals. Recruit and retain highly qualified and diverse professional policy and regulatory intelligence professionals, ensuring they are appropriately qualified, trained, and capable of providing necessary regulatory and policy leadership to support the GRAAS function and broader business

  • Interpret and anticipate changes in the regulatory environment

  • Communicate regulatory developments to stakeholders within Amgen

  • Partner with Global Government Affairs, Global Value & Access, Global Development, Medical Affairs, Quality, Clinical Development, and others to align Global Regulatory and R&D policy priorities

  • Lead key policy initiatives to shape the regulatory environment

  • Lead the development of position/white papers to support key Amgen policy initiatives.

  • Monitor legislative, regulatory and guidance developments and coordinate Amgen review and comment on documents.

  • Oversee the GRAAS Expert Review Group responsible for Amgen responses to published regulatory documents

  • Ensure Global Regulatory and R&D policy awareness and participation on key committees, conferences, and trade associations

  • Lead global policy initiatives or support regional activities for global policy initiatives

  • Keep abreast of Amgen product development plans and issues

Win

What we expect of you

We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The professional we seek is a leader with these qualifications.

Basic Qualifications

  • Doctorate degree & 8 years of regulatory affairs experience OR

  • Master’s degree & 10 years of regulatory affairs experience OR

  • Bachelor’s degree & 12 years of regulatory affairs experience AND

  • 8 years of direct managerial experience. Previous experience managing other managers

Preferred Qualifications

  • Advanced scientific, legal or public health degree (i.e. PhD, PharmD, MBA, JD) or bachelor’s with at least 15 years of pharmaceutical industry-related experience in drug development, public health and/or regulatory policy or law.

  • Trade association or coalition involvement and anticipates changes in the external environment to develops action plans

  • Experience developing and implementing advocacy strategies designed to spur external actions

  • Recognized expertise as an external thought leader

  • Ability to establish strategic relationships with internal and external customers and partners; interact with regulators, customers, or other outside stakeholders on business issues

  • Demonstrated strong written, spoken and presentation communication with ability to research, write briefings, policy positions and high-level communications

  • Demonstrated ability to assess and manage risk in a highly regulated environment

  • Demonstrated leadership skills and effectiveness in the areas of influence, team leadership, articulating and taking a position, negotiation, and conflict resolution.

  • Effective team building capabilities and demonstrated effective teamwork and people management skills with ability to adapt to diverse interpersonal styles

  • Demonstrated ability to make quality decisions in the absence of complete data and with substantial uncertainty.

They will also embody the Amgen leadership attributes which are:

  • Inspire : Create a connected, inclusive, and inspiring work environment that empowers talent to thrive

  • Accelerate : Enable speed that matches the urgency of patient needs by encouraging progress over perfection

  • Integrate : Connect the dots to amplify the collective power of Amgen to drive results for patients, staff, and shareholders

  • Adapt : Lead through change by adapting to an ever-changing environment and defining a clear course of action to deliver results

Thrive

What you can expect of us

As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being.

The annual base salary range for this opportunity in the U.S. is $277,673 - $339,378.

In addition to the base salary, Amgen offers a Total Rewards Plan comprising health and welfare plans for staff and eligible dependents, financial plans with opportunities to save towards retirement or other goals, work/life balance, and career development opportunities including:

  • Comprehensive employee benefits package, including a Retirement and Savings Plan with generous company contributions, group medical, dental and vision coverage, life and disability insurance, and flexible spending accounts.

  • A discretionary annual bonus program, or for field sales representatives, a sales-based incentive plan

  • Stock-based long-term incentives

  • Award-winning time-off plans and bi-annual company-wide shutdowns

  • Flexible work models, including remote work arrangements, where possible

Amgen’s Commitment to Our Staff

At Amgen, our mission is serving patients. Our staff are dedicated to pushing the boundaries of science to transform medicine and turn the tide on serious illnesses. Central to achieving this mission is our “people-first” philosophy.

We recruit the best talent, build an environment that facilitates career growth, and provide staff with the opportunity to make significant contributions for patients and our business.

We equip all our staff members to live well-rounded, healthy lives. Most recently, Amgen added benefits for transgender employees and continues to pride itself on industry-leading, family-friendly offerings for families of all compositions.

Job Title: Senior Manager, Systems Engineering - Combination Product Development
Job Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of.

Senior Manager, Systems Engineering - Combination Product Development

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will be the Senior Manager, Systems Engineering (SMSE) in the Combination Product Operations organization. The Systems Engineering team guides in the identification, development, commercialization and improvement of drug delivery technologies to provide optimal patient experience in administration of Amgen’s therapeutic products. As a leader in the organization, the SMSE will ensure the success of multi-functional drug delivery and combination product development efforts through their lifecycle from feasibility through commercial manufacture. The SMSE will work in collaboration with commercial and research colleagues in identification of user needs from market insights. The SMSE will lead a team responsible for the creation and management of system requirements, development of system architecture, and integration of subsystems. This will require ensuring robust system architecture across the interactions, dependencies, and interfaces of subsystems.

The SMSE will lead a team responsible for the integration of the system through clinical and market entry. The successful candidate will have demonstrated strength and success in managing interactions with key collaborators and colleagues from across process development, operations, research and development, and global commercial organizations to ensure accurate capture of the voice of customer and business into user needs.

Role Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for recruitment, mentoring, supervision, and directed professional development of a team of systems engineers.
  • Lead development of robust drug delivery systems and integrated development efforts applying best Systems Engineering principles in combination product development cycles.
  • Lead formal and ad-hoc technical and design reviews for the integrated system.
  • Spearhead system definition in conformance to global regulatory guidance and best engineering methods including User Needs and System Design Inputs.
  • Responsible for DHF development and clarity of structure across platform, combination product, and vendor structures to ensure quality and visibility.
  • Owns integration of requirements, risks, and implemented mitigations through downstream design outputs.
  • Drives system verification and validation strategies across platform and brand-specific presentations.
  • Owns system performance & reliability targets and subsystem allocations.
  • Provides authorship and expert technical leadership for regulatory filings.
  • Responsible for recruitment, mentoring, supervision, and directed professional development of more junior engineers.

Win

What we expect of you

We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The dynamic professional we seek is an experienced people manager with these qualifications.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Doctorate degree and 2 years of Systems Engineering experience OR
  • Master’s degree and 6 years of Systems Engineering experience OR
  • Bachelor’s degree and 8 years of Systems Engineering experience OR
  • Associate’s degree and 10 years of Systems Engineering experience OR
  • High school diploma / GED and 12 years of Systems Engineering experience

And

  • 2 years of managerial experience directly managing people and/or leadership experience leading teams, projects, programs or directing the allocation of resources.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Master’s Degree or PhD in Engineering in mechanical, systems, materials, electrical, or biomedical engineering.
  • 10+ years of demonstrated success in medical device, drug delivery, or combination product development for clinical and commercial entry.
  • 5+ years of demonstrated success leading development of system architecture and design for medical device, drug delivery, or combination products from concept through market entry.
  • Familiar with the following standards: US Good Manufacturing Practices (21 CFR Part 4, 21 CFR 210/211, 21 CFR 820); Needle-based Injection Systems (ISO 11608-1); Quality Management (ISO 13485); Risk Management (ISO 14971); EU Medical Device requirements (EU MDR 2021); Medical Electrical Equipment (EN 60601).
  • Demonstrated product design and development success through product launch in major global regulatory regions.
  • Successful experience managing multiple projects in a deadline driven environment.
  • Demonstrated strength in controlled development of user needs, market and system requirements, system and process verification and validation strategies, DOE / SPC / Risk Management methods.
  • Proficiency driving CTQ hierarchical decomposition (flow-down) to subsystems and components.
  • Strong technical communications, both written and oral at different levels of the business.
  • INCOSE certification or formal Systems Engineering training/certification.
  • Strong understanding of injection molding, electronics fabrication, system assembly and manufacturing processes.
  • Working knowledge of aseptic fill finish and controlled manufacturing environments.
  • Demonstrated success in platform product development with global multi-generation technology plans.
  • Robust knowledge of Quality Management Policies and Systems, practical experience in configuration management and change control process/requirements – CCB (change control board), CIT (change implementation team) concepts.
  • Proficient with Production Part Approval Process (PPAP) methodology, documenting requirements and providing traceability documentation for FDA Approval - DOORS, Requisite Pro, or other similar requirements management software.
  • Experience in leading continuous improvement activities by driving the implementation of process and product quality improvement initiatives.

Thrive

What you can expect of us

As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being.

  • Comprehensive employee benefits package, including a Retirement and Savings Plan with generous company contributions, group medical, dental and vision coverage, life and disability insurance, and flexible spending accounts.
  • A discretionary annual bonus program, or for field sales representatives, a sales-based incentive plan
  • Stock-based long-term incentives
  • Award-winning time-off plans and bi-annual company-wide shutdowns
  • Flexible work models, including remote work arrangements, where possible

for a career that defies imagination

Objects in your future are closer than they appear. Join us.

Job Title: Vice President, Clinical Development - Rare Disease
Job Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

At Amgen, every challenge is an opportunity. And every opportunity brings the potential to change lives. Our shared mission—to serve patients—has driven our status as one of the world’s preeminent biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Leverage your high-level expertise to lead and forge partnerships that advance the biotechnical and biopharmaceutical science that can turn the tide of serious, life-interrupting illnesses.

Vice President, Clinical Development - Rare Disease

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital VP role, you will lead the late clinical development strategy, planning and decision making for the Rare Disease therapeutic area (TA) as well as collaborate closely with counterpart leaders in Research, Early Development, Medical Affairs and Commercial functions to advance the Rare Disease pipeline and champion and contribute to business development opportunities in the Rare Disease area.

You are responsible for prioritization of staff engagement and development activities while actively pursuing diversity in thought as well as inclusion of people with different backgrounds within the TA. This position will report to Global Development VP of Rare Disease.

Responsibilities

  • Provide strategic, scientific and people leadership for the Rare Disease development pipeline and marketed products

  • Oversee late clinical programs within the Rare Disease area, defining the portfolio vision and strategy and mobilizing the team to execute against it

  • Serve as a senior advisor or executive sponsor for functional, cross-functional and/or corporate initiatives

  • Critically evaluate business development opportunities

  • Establish and nurture key strategic partnerships including public-private and private-private

  • Chair the TA Technical Review Committee for the disease area, driving cross-functional advice and providing approval for the scientific design of clinical trials

  • Create and maintain highly motivated development teams through leadership, people management and coaching with a focus on career development

  • Ensures effective performance management of direct reports through comprehensive goal setting, regular performance reviews, as well as direct and timely feedback

  • Foster a culture that attracts and retains the best talent

  • Support staff diversity, inclusion and belonging

  • Management of budget, processes, and people

  • Coaching and mentoring and developing scientific talent

Win

What we expect of you

We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The Vice President, Rare Disease professional we seek is a collaborative partner with these qualifications.

They will also embody the Amgen leadership attributes which are:

  • Inspire : Create a connected, inclusive, and inspiring work environment that empowers talent to thrive

  • Accelerate : Enable speed that matches the urgency of patient needs by encouraging progress over perfection

  • Integrate : Connect the dots to amplify the collective power of Amgen to drive results for patients, staff, and shareholders

  • Adapt : Lead through change by adapting to an ever-changing environment and defining a clear course of action to deliver results

Basic Qualifications

  • MD or DO degree from an accredited medical school AND

  • Five years of industry or academic research AND

  • 6 years of managerial experience directly managing people and/or leadership experience leading teams, projects, programs or directing the allocation of resources

Preferred Qualifications

  • MD plus accredited residency in relevant sub-specialty, board certified or equivalent

  • Ten (10) or more years of clinical research experience and/or basic science research combined with clinical teaching and patient care activities

  • Medical knowledge within

  • Clinical research experience in the biopharmaceutical industry (biotech, pharmaceutical or CRO company)

  • Proven ability to lead, manage, and motivate others in a complex, multi-functional matrix environment

  • Highly skilled in leveraging diverse thoughts and perspectives in clinical strategy development

  • In-depth understanding of the scientific method and clinical applications based on medical, scientific, and practical rationale

  • In-depth understanding of and proven success in how to conceptualize, design, and conduct complex, global clinical trials

  • Understanding of regulatory agency organization, guidelines, and practices and ability to negotiate with these groups

  • Knowledge of Good Clinical Practices (GCP), FDA regulations and guidelines, and applicable international regulatory requirements

  • Understanding of new drug commercialization and business practices

  • Understanding of resourcing and budgeting

  • Committed to actively bringing in diverse staff and ensuring their perspectives are included in work culture

  • Ability to effectively present ideas and document complex medical/clinical concepts in both written and oral communication

  • Demonstrated ability to organize and lead expert Clinical Research Advisory Panels

  • History of solving problems while exhibiting superior judgment and a balanced, realistic understanding of issues

Thrive

What you can expect of us

As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being.

The annual base salary range for VP level opportunities in the US is $307,500 – $512,500.

In addition to the base salary, Amgen offers a Total Rewards Plan comprising health and welfare plans for staff and eligible dependents, financial plans with opportunities to save towards retirement or other goals, work/life balance, and career development opportunities including:

  • Comprehensive employee benefits package, including a Retirement and Savings Plan with generous company contributions, group medical, dental and vision coverage, life and disability insurance, and flexible spending accounts.

  • A discretionary annual bonus program, or for field sales representatives, a sales-based incentive plan

  • Stock-based long-term incentives

  • Award-winning time-off plans and bi-annual company-wide shutdowns

  • Flexible work models, including remote work arrangements, where possible

At Amgen, our mission is serving patients. Our staff are dedicated to pushing the boundaries of science to transform medicine and turn the tide on serious illnesses. Central to achieving this mission is our “people-first” philosophy.

We recruit the best talent, build an environment that facilitates career growth, and provide staff with the opportunity to make significant contributions for patients and our business.

Job Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

At Amgen, every challenge is an opportunity. And every opportunity brings the potential to change lives. Our shared mission—to serve patients—has driven our status as one of the world’s preeminent biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide.

Leverage your high-level expertise to lead and forge partnerships that advance the biotechnical and biopharmaceutical science that can turn the tide of serious, life-interrupting illnesses.

Executive Director, Precision Medicine

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you as Executive Director, Precision Medicine for either Oncology, Cardio-metabolic or Inflammation/rare disease, you will partner with specific Therapeutic Area leads across Research & Development, guiding the development of translational, reverse translational, and precision medicine strategies.

You will be an important influencer for TA Governance bodies and be a direct member of the Precision Medicine Senior Leadership Team.  You will apply your deep subject matter and scientific domain expertise and will have the following responsibilities.

Responsibilities

  • Serve as thought partner and influencer to TA Governance (TAG) heads as the single point of accountability for the development and execution of strategies for translation, reverse translation, and precision medicine to deepen mechanistic insights, define indications/combinations based on understanding of disease & patient endotypes, enhance success, and overall value of the portfolio within the TA.

  • Foster a culture of collaboration and delivery, by leading a team of TA Precision medicine leads, who will drive cross functional teams composed of translational researchers, global biomarker leads, technical platform experts, data and analytic scientists, companion diagnostic (CDx) strategy leaders and other key functions.

  • Collaborate closely with the Research TA Head to embed translational and precision medicine considerations for development of assets within discovery phase to enhance pipeline quality and advance reverse translational strategies for late phase assets.

  • Mentor and guide Pmed leads within the TA on phase appropriate exploration of precision medicine considerations to inform asset development strategic options.

  • Identify appropriate data sources and internal and external partnerships to advance TA level biomarker and human data strategies to support translational, reverse translational and precision medicine strategies for the TA.

  • Be a thought leader for the identification and implementation of emerging technologies including AI into translational and biomarker development

  • Develop Pmed capabilities for the TA and Amgen, in partnership with the Precision Medicine unit head and leadership.

  • Serve as key collaborator and thought partner to Business Development, Medical and Commercial Biomarker Teams to help inform key partnerships and post market biomarker strategies

Win

What we expect of you

We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The Executive Director, Precision Medicine we seek is an experienced leader with the following qualifications.

They will also embody the Amgen leadership attributes which are:

  • Inspire: Create a connected, inclusive, and inspiring work environment that empowers talent to thrive

  • Accelerate: Enable speed that matches the urgency of patient needs by encouraging progress over perfection

  • Integrate: Connect the dots to amplify the collective power of Amgen to drive results for patients, staff, and shareholders

  • Adapt: Lead through change by adapting to an ever-changing environment and defining a clear course of action to deliver results

Basic Qualifications:

  • Doctorate degree & 6 years of precision medicine/translational research experience OR

  • Master’s degree & 10 years of precision medicine experience/translational research OR

  • Bachelor’s degree & 12 years of precision medicine experience/translational research AND

  • 6 years of managerial experience directly managing people and/or leadership experience leading teams, projects, programs or directing the allocation of resources

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MD, or PhD, with 10+ years industry & academic experience

  • Deep therapeutic area and disease experience, with a track record of success through publications, presentations, and on-market successes

  • Excellent written and oral communication skills

  • Executive level training

  • Direct experience in large pharma

  • Direct experience in diagnostic companies

  • Direct experience in therapeutic area discovery/research organizations

  • Direct experience in therapeutic area development organizations

  • Experience in software, analytics and/or AI methodologies.

  • Management experience leading and integrating cross-functional and technical teams

  • Deep scientific and analytical expertise in integrating multiple data sources e.g.–omic, clinical, RWE

  • Deep precision medicine experience applied to target TA’s (Onc, Cardiometabolic/Gen Med, and Inflammation)

  • Strong professional medical network (external KOLs, institutions, and partners)

As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being.

  • Stock-based long-term incentives

Win

Job Title: Executive Director, Global Safety Head, Obesity
Job Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

At Amgen, every challenge is an opportunity. And every opportunity brings the potential to change lives. Executive Director, Global Safety Head, Obesity

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role as the Executive Director, Global Safety Head, you will serve as the safety expert for Amgen’s obesity products globally and are accountable for the safety strategy and major safety deliverables for each product. You will lead the obesity safety teams and are accountable for the staff management and resource planning/allocation.

You will serve as a core member of Global Patient Safety Leadership team and will support the Head of Global Patient Safety (GPS) in the establishment of a highly effective global safety organization in full compliance with worldwide regulations.  This role reports into the Head of Global Patient Safety.

Responsibilities:

  • Serve as Safety expert in Obesity

  • Accountable for providing strategic oversight and direction for all regulatory safety responses or strategic deliverables, including but not exclusive to Safety sections of NDA submissions, RMPs, PSURs, PBRERs, DSURs, DILs

  • Chairs and participates in safety governance meetings per Standard Operating Procedures and Manuals

  • Oversee Obesity Safety input to contractual agreements with Business Partners and CROs

  • Works cross-functionally with Development and Regulatory TA Heads to reach issue resolution

  • Provide safety oversight, strategy and guidance to therapeutic areas and other groups within Clinical Development, Medical Affairs, Regulatory and the commercial organizations

  • Management of the Obesity safety teams providing direction and allowing appropriate prioritization of resources to achieve goals

  • Recruit and retain talented safety professionals and provide coaching, mentoring, and development of staff

  • Ensure staff are compliant with Amgen corporate and departmental training

  • Contribute to Global Patient Safety goals in development

  • Participate in budget and headcount planning

  • Leads or sponsors significant cross-functional projects, initiatives or training

  • Inspection Readiness

  • Be representative and point of contact for Health Authority Inspection and Internal Process Audits within the remit of role and responsibility

Win

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Clinical experience in either an accredited academic setting or private practice (including hospital based) setting

  • Previous product safety experience and knowledge of clinical trials and drug development

  • Knowledge of Obesity patient populations and drug classes

  • Proven history of effective leadership with a matrix organization

  • Knowledge of general medicine, clinical care, and principles of epidemiology

Job Description:
At Amgen, every challenge is an opportunity. And every opportunity brings the potential to change lives. Our shared mission—to serve patients—has driven our status as one of the world’s preeminent biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Leverage your high-level expertise to lead and forge partnerships that advance the biotechnical and biopharmaceutical science that can turn the tide of serious, life-interrupting illnesses.

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will be reporting to the Vice President, Global Value & Access and will lead the Inflammation therapeutic area within the Integrated Access Strategy function. This team is responsible for strategic planning to support value and access for all Amgen molecules in development, beginning in Phase I and extending throughout commercialization though to launch and lifecycle management across the Amgen portfolio. Additionally, the team is responsible for global strategic pricing, including recommendations for global price bands and launch sequence.

Each Integrated Access Strategy incorporates coverage and reimbursement, pricing, value evidence, and policy into the development of a strategic plan that supports the overarching commercial objectives and links to the clinical attributes of the molecule. This plan elucidates and communicates the strategies and tactics to secure and maintain access throughout the lifecycle of a specific molecule.

The Executive Director will lead a team of Access Strategy Leads who represent payer needs on the multi-disciplinary Product Team for one or more molecules. This will include the development of new plans as well as the update of prior plans to reflect changes in product data and/or the global payer environment. The Executive Director will also represent Global Value & Access on cross functional Therapeutic Area Governance (TAG) and be responsible for ensuring pricing and access considerations are embedded into the therapeutic area strategies.

Each member of the therapeutic area team led by the Executive Director must work collaboratively across functions to ensure a comprehensive view of his/her assigned products and create and maintain strong collaborative working relationships with key stakeholders. These stakeholders include colleagues in Health Economics and Outcomes Research, Operational Pricing, Advocacy, Health Policy, and Government Affairs and their respective Therapeutic Area heads for those functions represented on TAG (Research, Development, Regulatory, Medical, Operations, Marketing, and Project Management). The individual must also oversee and conduct relevant payer/pricing research and integrate clinical, market, and payer information to develop and communicate the plan.

In addition to product-specific responsibilities, each member of the team also participates in one or more cross-portfolio projects each year. These projects either serve to advance the team’s knowledge of and readiness for the global payer environment, support specific market or product assessments, or attempt to influence payer policy development. Examples include Payer assessments to support potential mergers/acquisitions, payer landscape in emerging markets, exploration of new payer trends (e.g., bundling), or development of a policy white paper to shape external price and reimbursement policies in the global arena.

Key responsibilities

  • Make strategic recommendations with a cross-functional Therapeutic Area and Amgen First mindset. Within TAG, the Executive Director IAS will be accountable to Portfolio Governance (PG) for Long Range Scenario (LRS) for all PTs within the TA, and portfolio decisions up to pre-specified investment thresholds

  • Assess commercial viability of early asset Target Candidate Profiles (TCPs), Target Product Profiles (TPPs) and programs as they approach Portal decisions (e.g., Commit to Registrational Studies Portal)

  • Conduct situational analysis of external pricing and reimbursement environment and synthesize relevant information to develop strategic plans

  • Develop and test value messages and value evidence with payers in order to determine the most compelling way in which to demonstrate and communicate product value to payers

  • Conduct qualitative and quantitative pricing studies and to formulate price policy recommendations

  • Formulate health policy strategy and implement these strategies to shape external pricing and reimbursement environment

  • Review clinical and health economic literature, including disease state information, clinical trial design and results, and pharmacoeconomic studies, in order to understand implications for value to payers

Win

What we expect of you

We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The professional we seek is a leader with these qualifications.

  • Doctorate degree & 6 years of global pricing, reimbursement, access experience OR

  • Master’s degree & 10 years of global pricing, reimbursement, access experience OR

  • Bachelor’s degree & 12 years of global pricing, reimbursement, access experience AND

  • 6 years of managerial experience directly managing people and/or leadership experience leading teams, projects, programs or directing the allocation of resources

Preferred Qualifications

  • Direct payer experience and/or experience in product commercialization is desirable

  • Strategic planning and health policy experience strongly preferred

  • Executive presence, influencing and communication skills

  • Ability to manage and lead sizeable (20 to 25), global team (US and Swiss based)

  • Global product launch experience in market

  • Experience negotiating with various governments

  • Regional Lead experience (EU, ASIA, LATAM) is desirable

  • Inflammation experience is strongly preferred

Job Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of.

Integrated Access Strategy Senior Manager

Live

What you will do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world! In the context of a rapidly evolving payer environment, Amgen’s increasing emphasis on geographic expansion, acquisition/licensing as drivers of growth, and a commitment to demonstrate product value, Amgen requires an increasingly sophisticated reimbursement and pricing capability to support market access. The capabilities of the Integrated Access Strategy (IAS) group, within the Global Value & Access function (GV&A), positions Amgen for future success against this business-critical imperative. This team is responsible for strategic planning of value and access for all Amgen molecules in development, beginning in Phase I-II and extending throughout commercialization across the Amgen portfolio. This work also includes lifecycle planning and access support for top 10 markets for selected in-the-market products. Additionally, the team is responsible for global strategic pricing, including recommendations for global price bands and indication/country launch sequence.

In this vital role you will report to the bemarituzumab Access Strategy Lead within the Oncology IAS team. The Value & Access Senior Manager role will support launch execution across top 10 markets, the global pricing and access strategy definition for the asset, as well as lifecycle planning and optimization for future indications. This role is global and strategic in nature and the Value & Access Senior Manager will interact cross-functionally within a variety of teams and in close collaboration with the HEOR, Operational Pricing Teams, Center for Observational Research (CfOR), Medical and Marketing counterparts. In addition, the Senior Manager will work closely with access leads in the top 10 Countries and be responsible for facilitating the Global Access Team (GAT) forum. In addition to product-specific responsibilities, the Senior Manager may participate in one or more portfolio projects to support the Oncology franchise with respect to developing a deeper understanding of the latest payer trends and health systems evolution. Such projects will require working cross-functionally within Amgen to further organizational goals within the Oncology franchise.

  • Support global launch activities for the top 10 markets including planning and updates of access materials for affiliates such as refinement of the Global Value Story and Objection Handler, pricing guidance materials, negotiation frameworks etc.
  • Run and facilitate the Global Access Team forum and ensure standard process sharing across top 10 markets and insights gathering to inform access, pricing and payer evidence strategy refinement for the asset
  • Support Pricing Governance for top 10 markets including development and preparation of regional and global pricing business cases
  • Support launch execution across top 10 markets including Response to Question (RTQ) support in collaboration with HEOR
  • Maintain the GV&A launch tracker and coordinate updates and refinements with top 10 markets and regional value & access leads
  • Support forecast / LRS for LCM indications and review top 10 markets pricing/access assumptions for in-line indications
  • With the ASL, conduct situation analysis and payer/pricing research of external pricing and reimbursement environment regarding different LCM indications, and synthesize relevant information to develop strategic recommendation for the Product Team
  • Support franchise level initiatives to develop the oncology market and optimize Amgen’s oncology, with a focus on payers & policy makers
  • The role may involve travel (less than 5% domestic and international).

Win

What we expect of you

We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The Access Strategy professional we seek is a professional with these qualifications.

Basic Qualifications:

Doctorate degree and 2 years of payer, market access and/or analytics experience

Or

Master’s degree and 4 years of payer, market access and/or analytics experience

Or

Bachelor’s degree and 6 years of payer, market access and/or analytics experience

Or

Associate’s Degree and 10 years of payer, market access and/or analytics experience

Or

High school diploma / GED and 12 years of payer, market access and/or analytics experience

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Launch experience, preferably in Oncology
  • Previous international (ex-US) assignment at country, regional or global level
  • Demonstrates a high degree of responsiveness to affiliate partners
  • Understanding of the payer environment in major countries, including coverage and reimbursement, pricing, health technology assessment, and health care policy
  • Ability to review clinical and health economic literature, including disease state information, clinical trial design and results, and pharmacoeconomic studies, in order to understand implications for value to payers
  • Translates complex situation and pricing analyses to effectively communicate impact to Amgen business
  • Demonstrates a high degree of responsiveness to affiliate team members
  • Demonstrated ability to plan strategically, identify strategic options and trade-offs
  • Manages in a highly fluid, interactive, matrixed environment and build strong, successful business partnerships with affiliate and global colleagues
  • Delivers individual results and results through others
  • Displays self-awareness and a high level of EQ
  • Demonstrates listening skills and welcomes challenges, and is open-minded
  • Strong oral/written presentation skills

Thrive

As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being.

You’ve worked hard to become the professional you are today and are now ready to take the next step in your career. How will you put your skills, experience and passion to work toward your goals? At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Come do your best work alongside other innovative, driven professionals in this meaningful role.
Specialist IS Business Systems Analyst

Live

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will be part of Amgen's newest and most sophisticated final product assembly and packaging plant. The Final Product facility will not only feature the best in-class device assembly and packaging technologies with embedded industry 4.0 capabilities, but it will also integrate sustainability innovations to reduce carbon and waste, as part of Amgen's plan to be a carbon-neutral company by 2027.
As a Specialist IS Business Systems Analyst at Amgen, you will support the analysis, design, and implementation of information systems solutions to meet business requirements. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and document system requirements, perform system testing, troubleshoot issues, and provide end-user support.   • Effectively manage relationships with IS service owners, business partners, enterprise IS service partners, and vendors.
  • Communicates with multiple levels within the organization, highlighting issues and proposing solutions.
